I tried this on multiple PC's with the same result...connects for 20 seconds, then won't stay connected.

Total waste of money.
summary: Device didn't connect for more than 20 seconds at a time

reviewText: I thought I was getting a good deal, but this does not work. I thought it was just me, but I tried the standard def cable that shipped with my 360 and that worked with no problem. This cable does not work on any TV, but I guess I got what I paid for.

What a mess of a game. This game attempts to be like GTA or Saints Row but it fails miserably.

The story is a joke, the characters are boring. The only thing somewhat good is the play control.

I am about 8 hours in so far and I have yet to be amazed even once.

It will be a chore to finish this turd of a game.

This game has bugs and crashes a lot. I can't say how much this game has crashed while playing through it. There is a certain area that I just can't get through, because the game crashes every single time.

I've redownloaded this game literally 7 times, and each time I try to get it to work, the patch updater fails consistently forcing me to redownload and reinstall. Lack of PC support seems to be a thing with Rockstar games, needless to say I'm never buying a Rockstar PC game again.

I waited 21 hours for the download to complete only to receive installation errors. I've never had problems installing games before, so I'm blaming Amazon's digital download service. Now I have to try and figure out how to deal with all this to get the game working and I've already spent a couple hours google searching for answers.

We tried using these adapters as soon as they arrived and they never would work. We would calibrate our remotes and get the OK sign and the second we would try and start a game, they wouldn't work, so we would go back and our remotes would be spinning so we would calibrate again, and again, and again. I was trying to avoid buying all new remotes but apparently the adapters aren't the way to go. Or maybe it's just these.

This game is like all the other AC games its boring as hell. If you like to walk around and talk to people this is the game for you as for me i need more action. If i wanted to walk around and talk to people i would do it in real life except i wouldnt wear a dress.

If your sensor bar doesn't work and you're looking for a replacement.... well, your chance of luck is in this product. It may or may not work for you. I got it to replace my sensor bar and it still didn't work. I thought my Wii had a problem. I tried a used sensor bar from another Wii and it works. This new one doesn't. Some reviews says it does but I'm telling you for me at least, it don't.
summary: May work for some but not all.

reviewText: This game is really stupid and not challenging at all.  In fact the only challenge is how long can you sit there before getting so bored that you have to turn it off.  It's basically a movie that you just watch.  If you die, it doesn't matter because you just come back to life.  If a member of your party dies, you just bring them back to life.  No problem. I don't think there is a way to loose.  I think a child may find this game interesting. If you are old enough to read this, buy something else.

I have no idea why people review this game so highly. While the graphics are pretty the gameplay is monotonous and nothing but a bunch of strung together cutscenes with underdeveloped characters that I had little feeling for. I gave the game a solid 30 hours of gameplay before giving up and deciding it was a waste of my efforts and time.

If you are a fan of JRPGS and looking for a game to allow you a fun battle system, an engaging storyline and diverse environments then this is not a game for you.

I'm not going to lie. I'm not a huge MGS fan. However, I bought this at the time where there wasn't a ton of games available for the Vita. If you are a MGS fanatic you will probably love this game.

However, for me as someone who never played MGS before - the controls are horrendous and ruined the experience of the game. I really felt like it was a port (which it is) and not an actual game, if that makes sense.
summary: Great if you are a die hard fan, horrible if you aren't and deal with the controls

reviewText:
I bought this because: Sim City!

I should have paid attention to the reviews. The DRM meant that if their servers were having trouble, I could not play my game, and since EA apparently way underestimated the number of servers they would need, I could not even play my game once it arrived at my home. Servers were always down or full, so I could not play the game for which I paid all that money.

I will NEVER buy another EA game. EVER.
summary: I so regret buying this game

reviewText: EA is horrible and they ruined another game.  I bought this on pre order and couldn't play it for a couple of days.  When I finally did, the maps were small and I had problems playing with my friend.  The game is so horrible I haven't even played it in 5 months even though I bought it.  Not worth my time.

If I could rate this game lower I would.

I was really excited to get this game and I preordered it due to all the hype.

I'm sorry I bought it. EA should be ashamed of this game. It bogs down and is buggy. I constantly get an error saying the game is unstable and it crashes, losing all of my progress.

In short, don't buy it.

I have never been more disappointed by a video game before. I'm not writing this review on day one while I'm angry about not being able to log in, I waited it out, I waited for version 2.0 despite preordering this game and being unable to play it at all for the first few days.
This game isn't worth playing, even if they fixed all of the well known issues they'd need to make the maps about 5 times larger before I'd even bother trying again.

The game is fun, I really enjoyed it, but it is like eating a really good steak, or rather just a good steak, but having it covered in cheap stale steak sauce.

If you don't have internet all or nearly all the time you will be unable to play the game, and for no reason other than the irrational fear of piracy. It also seems to slow everything down every time you have to wait for data to transfer. Nothing about your game is stored locally. All of your saves are stored on EA's file servers.

Here are two quotes from EA President Frank Gibeau: "SimCity started out and felt like an MMO more than anything else and it plays like an MMO." And "I'm disappointed that we didn't do a better job communicating that upfront."

As none of the previous games in the series was, or aspired to be a MMO, I feel like I've been misled.

Bottom line: If you want to play SimCity on your own this game is not for you.

The title says it all. This game is not up-to-par with any previous SimCity game, other than Simcity Social. If you want to play Simcity Social, you can play for free on Facebook, and the servers for that are actually up.
summary: Shouldn't be called SimCity, shouldn't be $60.

reviewText: This is a single player game that's currently gimped due to the multiplayer infrastructure. But it's also a multiplayer game... that has none of the social features you would expect from an MMO game. Hopefully they can learn from their mistakes, but I doubt it.

This game had/has so much promise, but in nearly every way, it is more of a beta release than a fully developed game.  After putting up with the server issues the first week, it's clear the simulation of city activity doesn't work.  In theory, Maxis can fix those issues, but it's not nearly there yet.  It's hard to imagine why this game was released in its current state.

I regret buying this game...I spent $60 on it and I am so disappointed. I have not bought a game in over a year and I was excited to try this. I could not even play for the first week that I got it because it kept saying to server was down. I did not know when I bought it that I had to be on the internet to play it- I would have NEVER bought it. $60 down the drain!!!

Not sure why the developers found it necessary to keep the always-online DRM in this product, as they were warned well in advance of the product's release that many gamers would sit this one out because of it.  Lo and behold, the DRM doesn't work.  The idea that you have to be online in order to play a single player game by yourself is absolutely ludicrous.

I've owned this game for five days, and thus far, I have only been able to play the tutorial once and create three cities.  The game didn't save any of my cities, and the next time I tried to play, it made me play the whole tutorial again.  THEN I selected a server, which said was available, but wouldn't allow me to create or join any regions.  It kept telling me to go to the main menu and try again. I'll wait a few more days and see if the issues are fixed, but this is seriously ridiculous!

I'm a long-time fan of the Sim games, and was looking forward to introducing Sim City 5 to my kids. No more. I want to play it offline if I want to, as I travel a lot, and that's when I usually have the time to do it. Sorry, EA; the game looks great, but you've really dropped the ball on this one.

I also have to say my experience with this game has been entirely negative. The problem is not that there are not enough servers, it's that there is no reason for a single player game to require servers at all. You cannot save your games on your own computer. If they put out a new version and close this down, all of your games will be gone. I will continue to rate this at 1 star until they come out with an update to no longer require play on EA's servers. Shame on EA for this crappy game.
summary: Tell me when it no longer requires servers.

reviewText: This game has a lot of potential, but so far I haven't been able to play.  You are required to be connected to the internet to play this game.  So far the EA servers have been down or spotty since I got the game.  I really hate having to be connected to play. I understand about the multiplayer, but I don't play multiplayer games, especially with a game like Simcity.  I want to like this game, but so far it hasn't giving me a chance to.
summary: May rate higher if I could ever get it to work

reviewText: You must be online to play this game. That means if your internet is down, away from your home (without a solid internet connection), or at some point when EA decides to stop supporting the game servers you won't be able to play anymore.  This is a serious concern for a $60 game.  I was quite excited for this but after reading more than a few terrible reviews, my $60 is better spent elsewhere.

I don't know if this qualifies as a product review because I am having no success in connecting to the server. I've been trying for about an hour but it didn't let me in once. I haven't played the game but I give 1/5 rating because they are not letting me play the game I purchased for 60 dollars. I hate it. I wish I could return it.

However, 9 out of 10 times that I try to play it, some server is offline preventing you from playing it.  Unfortunately, 3 days after launch, the game is still largely unplayable, and the situation doesn't seem to be getting any better.
summary: The game is fun when you're lucky enough to actually play it

reviewText:
This always on DRM is ridiculous. Being forced to have an always on connection to play what is essentially a single player game is ridiculous. EA is ridiculous.

I've had this game for a couple of days now and I've yet to play it. Server are always down. When I do connect, I'm disconnected even before a game can start.

EA needs to patch this game so you can play it without an internet connection. What a bunch of BS.
summary: DRM so effective that I nor anyone else can play it

reviewText: I can't play this game.  I would love to!  It just won't let me!  WTF have you done to this game EA/Marxis?  This is pathetic.  This game should be offline and single player.  What if I don't have internet access and I want to play this game?  I am requesting a refund.  Will never buy an always online game ever again.

Being an "older gamer" I have seen a lot of bad product launches since the mid-80's.  This is by far the worst.  If there was ANY way to get a refund I would and I will NEVER buy another EA game.  SimCity is not an MMO and even if it was, EA has proved they have no concept how to design and build the infrastructure to support one.  If you haven't yet purchased, save yourself hours of frustration and go elsewhere.

Always online DRM is a terrible idea.  I have had the game since it released, and I have been able to play it twice.  If the servers can't handle being online at all times, then there should be an offline option for those of us who don't care about playing with other people.

I didn't buy this game because all of the reviews for it are so horrible. I LOVE SimCity. Can't tell you how many times I've played it. This game, however, with the always on DRM, will NEVER be purchased by me. Sorry, EA. You failed big time here.

I bought the prerelease and I'm sorry I spent the money. I held off writing a review until EA had a chance to fix their growing pains. Unfortunately, EA has attempted to fix their growing pains, and the game still doesn't work. The tutorial starts, nothing is displayed, and it sucks. I'd give it zero stars if I could. I petitioned EA for a refund and they refuse to honor it.
summary: It's about as fun as you can have not playing something

reviewText: There's a lot I could say about this game, but I'd be wasting my time. DO NOT BUY. The other reviews are spot on, horrific game, horrific execution, there's literally not a single positive thing I can say about it even if I struggled.

This is what the world of gaming looks like when Electronic Arts gets their hands on a great franchise.

E.A. destroyed Command & Conquer, the greatest RTS series of all time. They ruined Ultima Online, once the leading MMORPG. Now they've made a laughing stock of SimCity, the best city building series every developed.

Do not reward these people with your money.

I did.

And now I'm stuck waiting in an online queue to play a single player game.

Yeah.

EA has completely lost touch with it's fan base. In an attempt to stop people from pirating their (wildly successful) franchise, they are taking out their frustration on all of us. EA has become one of the worst video game producers of late, they are slowly poisoning each and every franchise they own. I will never buy from them again they just want more money in their wallets and don't care about the end user or the long term viability of their company or products. They don't listen, they don't learn.

I've had the game since launch and haven't been able to play more than a couple minutes of it. I can't even comment on the other issues I've heard about such as land plot size and game play quirks because I just haven't been able to start up and continuously play a proper game.
summary: When do I get to play?

reviewText:
This game comes with an "Always Online" policy to enforce DRM.

Unfortunately, EA controls the servers the game requires us to connect to and they have proven, in the most amateurish way possible, that they are not able to support a game like this. As a result, despite trying, I have yet to play this game.

I am constantly told to check back again.

As others have pointed out already - I have paid $60 for a game that cannot even be launched.

Look at your plant. Now back at your SimCity. Now back at your plant. Now back at your SimCity. Sadly, your SimCity doesn't move as fast as your plant. That could be solved if you play an earlier version of the game and let EA rot with their servers. I'm on a horse now.
summary: As fun as watching my plants grow

reviewText: I'm not into playing these types of games with people, I'd rather play alone.  If I play alone, I still have to have a constant internet connection in order for the game to be playable, period.  You have zero choice.  There are so many things wrong with this game, I don't have time to lay them out.  I would not recommend this game to anybody.  EA does not care about the gamer at all.

I was going to get this game until I found out you need to always be connected to the Internet. I don't have Internet at my house, I just use my phone. So I guess I'm not getting this one.
Also, I wouldn't support another one of these always online games anyways. If they want my money, don't make it harder for me because you don't want to lose alittle money from pirates.
You have enough money ea, stop being greedy...

This game requires a persistent Internet connection even if you want to play it single player, by yourself, with no interaction with other players at all.

Additionally, that's a best-case scenario. If the servers go down or are otherwise unreachable, which is completely out of your control, you are unable to play the game at all.

Bought this game because I've had SimCity 2000, 3000, 3000 Unlimited and 4.

I had high hopes but as of yet I've been only able to do the following:

1) Install the game
2) Play the tutorial

That's it. Then I was told the server was busy. Then I was put in a queue for 45 minutes.

Then I tried another server and it tried to make me go through the tutorial again. Then the game sat at loading the tutorial for 30 minutes.

Very disappointed and wish I could return it.

This was just a letdown. I can't believe money was spent on this. It's just bad. The developers do such a great job, it's a shame they're forced to implement backward-ass DRM. It would be a decent game if it weren't for EA's nazi requirements to play the game, so I won't be playing this game ever, and I will never support EA ever again.

Yeah, I bought it. Yeah, I attempted to play it. Yeah, I was excited to revisit the classic days of SC3k and SC4. Yeah, I had to attempt several times to force my way through. Yeah, once I got in it was a little buggy. Yeah, the fun factor wasn't completely there.

The end.
summary: Throwing my hat in the ring

reviewText: I have to say that the game was enjoyable and deep in it's AI as well as the visual aspects of it, it was very fun during my beta testing.  However, I will not be buying the game because of the DRM system.  Not only will I not buy a game that requires me to be online all the time (unless it's a MMO) but I won't be buying a game that in 10 years time I can't get nostalgic and begin to play again because EA has decided they no longer want to support the game.  Nope, not getting any of my money here.
summary: Won't be buying it, although beta tested it

reviewText: Unfortunately, by limited they mean limited use.  As in, they only allow a limited number of players a limited view of the game for a limited time.  They could shut down the servers at any time and no one would be able to play at all.  There is no good reason to do this for a single player game.
summary: They weren't kidding when they said Limited Edition!

reviewText:
Tons of people have summed up my problems with this game. I'm a longtime fan of the series, been playing it for years and loving it. EA'S DRM has RUINED one of my all-time favorite series. DO NOT buy this game. There are tons of similar games you get get that aren't from EA.

In fact, if this is what EA thinks a business model should look like, I'm going to avoid buying any games from EA from now on. They've lost a long-time fan.

I bought the game yesterday and after a few hours of trying to log in to the servers I eventually just gave up. It is really frusturating to think I spent 60 dollars on a game I can't even play because the makers weren't willing to fork over some extra money for servers. As for the game play itself I wouldnt know because I have never accessed it.

Enjoy.
summary: Bought the game but I still haven't been able to play it

reviewText: I'm using a brand new rig: 2.6 GHz quad-core i7, 16GB of RAM, GT650 with 1GB of RAM--in short, meeting the game's recommended settings, not just the minimum requirements. And the game is choppy and unplayable on medium settings. In addition, the mouse is out of sync somehow with the in-game menus. I have to use the arrow keys on my keyboard to navigate the in-game menus, since I can't click any buttons with the mouse.

I have been trying to download this game for the past three days.  Extremely disappointed with Origin's service.  I keep getting an error that reads "File Not Found.  There is a problem with the download service.  Please try again later.  Error: 7049:404."

This is absolutely ridiculous.

I am so disappointed with this product that I had to return mine. It does not fit my ps vita and it's so troublesome to send it back since i don't have much time to spare. so i would not recomend this product for any ps vita users
summary: Do not but...does not fit ps vita

reviewText: This controller doesn't work as it was described (it was described as a working controller), but it still has its uses. Now when I have little kids over my house I just plug it in and don't have to worry about them messing anything up or figuring out its not plugged in. It just plugs in, lights up, and doesn't do anything! Also when I rage over games I don't have to worry about breaking my good working controllers, I just grab this one and smash away, because, hey why not? It doesn't work anyway.

I noticed it had a cut in the cord after I bought it, but I ignored it. It worked great for a long time, but eventually that cut in the cord started to take effect, and the only way I could use it was to hold it a certain way. Not ordering from these guys again.

I bought this to use with my Steam games, but this controller doesn't work with Windows 8 -- you have to install third party software to get it to work with Windows, and the only (free) third party software I could find did not yet support Windows 8. This was a complete waste of my money, so I went ahead and bought an actual Microsoft controller, which works much more easily.

DON'T BUY THIS!!!! Where do I even begin on this thing lol... It's literally so bad. It's not Xbox brand, it's like some cheap imitation of the Xbox controller. The analog sticks are CRAZY STIFF and the controller is all too lightweight and easy to break. This is probably the worst gaming controller I've ever used. If someone rates this thing 5 stars, they obviously haven't had that much time gaming. By the way, if you play FPS games and you get this controller, you're gonna suck.... really bad.

Did not work very well for my gaming PC. It worked great for about an hour. Then after that I had to un-plug and plug it back in every ten minutes or less just to get it to work. It might work for an X-Box, but I would not recommend for a PC. I returned it and got my money back.
summary: Not what I expected. Performance wise.

reviewText: Whenever I got it. I plugged it into my pc and one of the buttons did not work. Very disappointed. Especially because I had been looking for one of these for awhile. I wouldn't recommend buying one of these.

This cheap controller just doesn't work correctly in any way. I bought it to use on a computer and often times the controller will freeze up, leaving you stuck running in one direction until you manually unplug and re-plug it back in. This often happens every 5 minutes or so. Would not recommend at all.

I thought I was getting a deal here, but found out that I got (less) than what I paid for.  This is a cheap knockoff fake Xbox controller.  It functions, but the feel is terrible.  The buttons make audible clicks and the joysticks have very little tension making them difficult to control.  I'm sorry I purchased this.  I usually find products on Amazon to be of high quality, so I let my guard down and didn't bother to read the reviews.  I won't make that mistake again.
summary: Beware - This is a cheap knockoff

reviewText: I had bought this for my girl's for Christmas & decided to take it out of the package & test it before I wrapped it, I'm glad I did, the thing don't light up at all & I tried contacting the company to see what I can do & I can't get ahold of anyone. Don't waste your time these don't work!
summary: A bad Christmas gift when they don't work!

reviewText: Doesn't even work. I charged these packs to full charge and when I put them in the controller, the controller doesn't sync with the receiver. As soon as I put a regular battery pack in the controller, it syncs right away.. It's like these batteries are the wrong voltage. Don't buy, they simply do not work.

I have had nothing but problems with this charger. You have to make sure the battery pack is in there just right for it to charge. We've had to resort to using AA batteries alot since we got this. I finally got fed up and ordered a new one that is made by microsoft.

doesn't work at all i plugged it in and in five minutes it said the batteries were fully charged. then when i use them they died in a few minutes this happened every time i put in the batteries. even if i left the batteries in for a few hours they still died in a few minutes.

I have had so much trouble with these batteries. For whatever reason, these batteries prevent the controller from pairing with the Xbox 360. This is probably Microsoft being lame, but if they don't work at all, they should not be available for sale! Not only that, but the product is just poorly made. It doesn't fit properly into the controller, and you have to force the batteries into the included charger. If I can't return them, they're going in the trash.
summary: Prevents controllers from connecting to Xbox! DO NOT BUY!

reviewText: I was hoping to replace my regular rechargeable batteries with this set but I have only been able to charge them one time and now they won't even charge/make contact anymore. I can't get the charge light to come on when I mount the batteries to the charger. The build quality of this is mediocre. I feel I should send them back but I don't want to spend more energy on this item.
summary: Was able to charge them once

reviewText: It is a game that plays over a period of years, so it takes a while to finish......but it is not possible, because the game will not load after you have saved it a few times. We have tried numerous times to not only load, but start over to have the same thing happen again and again. I would not recommend this game.

I gave this only one star because I never received it.  I had ordered it, it was on my order form and was supposed to have been shipped with another product (gumballs).  I opened the box, and the box of gumballs was the only item in the box.  The Game Card Case was listed as 'shipped', but it was never received.  I have since received a refund, and was asked to re-order it.  I didn't re-order it, because I shouldn't have had to.  I didn't WANT a refund.  I wanted the item instead.
summary: The Card Case That Never Came

reviewText: To be fair I can't really review this product other than to say that mine was Dead On Arrival (DOA). I was further irritated by the fact that I couldn't get a replacement but instead had to send the defective one back and start the order process all over again. That was 6 or more weeks ago and I still haven't bothered to order another one. I may not.

Apparently this type of converter doesn't work with the type of projector that we were going to use it with.  We plugged it in and couldn't figure it out until we did some research online about it.  So if you are planning on using this with a projector and not a regular hd television then don't bother with it.

I bought this game for my son and spent almost $50.00 for it only to find out 30 days later that you can't play the game unless you pay another $14.95/month.  What is the point of paying for the game upfront if you have to pay monthly?!?!

We bought two of these in hopes that this MMO lived up to its promises. Sadly, it did not. It's decent and the graphics are great but the content is not that much different than any of the others we've played in the last 12 years. Shame because the beta was pretty decent but the end result is lack luster. The crafting system needs a serious overhaul and there are some issues. After a couple of weeks we've left the game. Shame, really.

It just wasn't what I thought it would be.

I bought the game so my nephew and I could play it (we play 'Left for Dead' ALL THE TIME), but I'm pretty sure he's going to want to take the game right out as soon as he puts it in. Not our style.

I purchase this game for my daughter for Christmas and it would not play in her xbox.  Thinking we just got a bad game, I returned it to Amazon for an exchange.  Got the new game, same problem.  I googled it and apparently everything is experiencing the same issue.  I read somewhere that the downloaded version for xbox doesn't have the same issue.  But as far as the DVD, don't bother.

Even if this software worked properly, it wouldn't be a great game. It's slow and the storytelling is ham-fisted. But the bottom line is that it does not work properly and the myriad bugs are well documented online.

There are bugs that prevent you from progressing through the story.
There are bugs that prevent you from continuing from your last saved game.
There are bugs that prevent you from starting the next chapter after having completed the previous one.

In short: Don't bother.
summary: Slow story, wonky gameplay, and BUGGY

reviewText: Got this as a xmas present and all of the one star reviews are true.  The disc has some serious flaws.  It skips, it freezes, it lags, it is very slow.  At first I thought it was my xbox, but then when I read the reviews on amazon, I realized that it was the disc.  Will be returning and getting my money back.  This game should have never been released.

Hello,
I just got this game and it doesn't work on the new iMac at all.  First the text of the game didn't work.  Apparently newer iMacs and Mac Book Pros have this issue.  One work around is to try to switch to window mode and then back to full screen.  This also didn't work, and preceeded to crash my computer.  This was money not well spent.  Maybe it'll work in the future.

The game play is no where near as seamless as the PS3. Controls are awful, and glitchy. I am not sure what I was expecting, but this game is nearly unplayable. ALSO, if you care at all about online multiplayer, there are at best 100 people online at any given time, and the learnung curve is awful. I do not recommend this platform at all! It is great for PS3.

I have played them all - from the first one on (extensively). This one is my least favorite. The maps are horrendous. Some maps are so big you have to run around like crazy to find anyone to kill. On other maps (like the ship) it's so linear it's almost boring. This is my least favorite of them all. If I could I would take back the time I spent playing it.

The game is OK at first, but then you get to a point (pretty quickly) where no matter how hard you try, you start to lose. The user interface is very hard to use and it took quite a while to remember where everything was. Support is not available(I was directed to a fan blog site). In the end, the impending doom (lose) and the hard to use game controls made me wish I had not bought this game.

So far, I hate this game. The tutorial is extremely frustrating. You do exactly what it tells you to do, but it doesn't count. Or, it tells you an "easy" command, and you try to do it, and it doesn't work. I've been at this for probably a half hour just trying to do the ridiculous tutorial.

I bought this item for my 15-year-old son to use when playing video games. It worked fine at first but then the sound stopped working after less than 2 months. He did not do anything unusual with the headset, simply wore it while playing games. I contacted the seller to ask if this was unusual for the headset to stop working so soon, but did not get a helpful response to my first email, and the seller did not respond at all to my second email. I would not buy this item or use this seller again.
summary: Stopped Working in Under 2 Months of Average Use

reviewText: There is a known issue with the PC port of Prototype 2 that will cause the game to crash to desktop when attempting to load. Some users have reported that disconnecting their USB keyboards will resolve the issue. I was able to get almost past the initial loading screens by doing this, but, still crashed before the main menu. It appears the developer is no longer around so chances of a fix are slim. At this time, it's impossible to recommend this game as it simply does not work.
summary: Known issues cause crash to desktop (primarily with USB keyboards.)

reviewText: After less than an hour of play, the D-pad broke off completely. The controller itself is too light and small compared to the real thing, and the buttons feel almost as fragile as the D-Pad, protruding much too far from their enclosure.
summary: D-pad broke an hour into using it

reviewText:
This is a horrible purchase. I just received it today and within 5 minutes of opening it and connecting it to my computer it broke. This is poorly put together. the D-pad comes right off and all 6 buttons on the right are so loose that they can pop out. Dont waste money on this product.

The company has fully refunded me for the product and is not having me ship it back. They were very prompt in helping the customer out

I am assuming that the other versions of this game are good. I bought the PC version and it is basically unplayable; there are so many glitches and hang-ups that are clearly due to this being developed for a different platform. It was a waste of my gaming budget and time. What a shame because it seems like it would be a fun game.

This might be a great game, but I was too frustrated with the clumsy PC controls to give it more than 30 minutes of playing.  The camera is clumsy, the controls are not intuitive, and the menus are either too large for the screen or too small to read.  Perfect example of how not to port a game from a console to the PC.
summary: Hard to play on the PC

reviewText: This is by far the most broken game I have ever attempted to play.  There have been 3 patches and the game still crashes to desktop within 3 minutes of playing.  This is the most glitchy bug ridden game I have ever seen.  I wonder if they ever tested this game on pc at all.

As a beta tester, I felt his game had quite a bit of promise.  When it went on sale on Steam, I picked up a copy.  Unfortunately, I can't access the game at all.  The launch client says I need to use a game key, which should be provided from Steam.  As far as I can tell, there's no key available.  I've tried researching my issue on the forums, and contacting customer support from both the publisher and Steam.  Nothing has worked, and I'm stuck with a game I can't play.
summary: Unable to play.  Customer service has been useless

reviewText: I got two of these, one after the other they were broken. The first one worked for a few minutes and then it suddenly wouldn't move click or anything. The second one lasted a couple of hours more but still the same outcome. No idea why this is happening as I have a Microsoft mouse that works just fine. I got these because they are for gaming.

The story in the game was very intriguing but the first few battles were so hard to get through that I gave up and traded it in. I really wanted to be able to play this game badly, but it was just too hard.

This is a "streaming" videogame from STEAM. You never actually own anything and you have to have internet connection to play. You don't just simply download to your computer. You download a whole other service to play this game. It is a SCAM! DO NOT PURCHASE. There is no way to play these games offline.
summary: Blind sided with something I wouldn't have paid for...

reviewText: If you're looking for grip... you're not gonna get it with this. It gets the controller crazily dirty underneath the skin, and if your hands sweat when you're using this, you will not get any grip. You're better off not using this if you have sweaty hands while gaming. It WON'T make a difference. As for the texture of the product, it's very thin, looking like it'll rip easily, and it seems to have a little bit of friction.

This Controller is fake. It is a fake produce of a xbox 360 controller. I bought this controller a few months ago, but when I first bought it, the left joy stick gave out on me on the 2nd day, it kept moving around on its own, and within a few more days the joy stick of the controller would just keep going right even though i was not touching it. This is a fake controller never buy this, trust me. It is better to get a genuine xbox 360 controller that only cost a few bucks more then this.

If you want to spend your time installing the game first, then patch after patch, after it fails when you try to play it, then this is the game for you. If you have a life, and want something better to do, then this might not be your thing!
summary: Should Have Paid Me For This Crap!!

reviewText:
Day 3. Still have not been able to play the game because it's still "updating". It's needed at least four separate updates, and has crashed my computer at least twice now.

Edit 1: The game is completely unplayable. The game starts and crashes instantly. It says "Thank you for playing Splinter Cell Blacklist". This is pretty much a slap to the face. Do yourself a favor and pirate the game. You'll get a better experience.
summary: Ubisoft needs take some tips from Valve's Steam or abandon uPlay.

reviewText: There are so many issues that are keeping this game from loading up, I can't even begin to describe.  Ubisoft and Steam support are unbelievably unhelpful.  I would wait a good amount of time before buying this game, so that Ubisoft will release a mega-patch that will fix all the issues.  As for me, I wasted $60 on empty space on my computer.  Will change my review in the future when I can actually play the game.
summary: Will not load, and Ubisoft Suport/Steam doesn't help.

reviewText: You get killed almost immediately and you don't live long enough to see where your death comes from. Also you have to deal with people who cheat. I would much rather play against the computer. I won't be coming back for more any time soon.

This game does not work on Windows 8.1.  The application starts with an error message and then stalls.  I could not use it. Also don't count on tech support.  They are absolutely horrible and don't care.  I was never able to make this app work on a computer.  Total waste of money.

For anyone who believes that a game should just work after it has been downloaded, installed, and registered, do not buy this game. It freezes in "synchronizing" mode upon loading. On the other hand, iff you enjoy tinkering with the game for hours in fruitless attempts to get it to work, it's right up your alley.

Purchased this on Amazon as it seems the only place to find the gold edition. I would have prefered a digital download so I didn't have to wait for delivery. When I finally got my package and put the disc in...the disc was BLANK. No game nothing. I really don't understand how this could happen and its pretty upsetting. I contacted the company and I am still waiting for a response. What a bummer.

I wish I could say the kids and I are having a ton of fun playing this game. We had a free trial a while ago, and had a blast. So I downloaded it today from Amazon (it's half the price on this site), but no-one in my family can figure out how or where to load the key/ code number to play the game. I guess you can tell that I'm not particularly computer savvy, but I'm not stupid and this is just extremely frustrating and a waste of time/ money. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

This game is a lot of fun and full of imaginative wordplay. What I hated is that after a time, the online version I bought developed some kind of problem and was unceremoniously yanked from use by its distributor. The replacement they offered was not even close to the original. It seems to me that if you buy something that exists online, the company has an obligation to maintain its files and keep it going. I'm disappointed and won't buy any more.
summary: Loved the game; hated what happened to it

reviewText: The game hasn't changed very much but forcing one to use Origin to play it ruins the game. I have purchased this game in the past and never had this problem. I wasn't aware of the Origin link or didn't understand it when purchasing the game. Maybe there are better places to buy games. I am very disappointed with Amazon for allowing this.
summary: link to Origin ruins the game

reviewText: I love the game but trying to install it is such a pain that it's not worth it.  I do NOT like the Origin requirements.  I was trying to download it in a hurry - but with the additional Origin software I ended up not being able to make it work.  That was a waste of money and time.

Hi,  I just wanted this one action figure.  I got a set of three.  I also got two different packages of the set of three.  I didn't ask my husband if we got charged for the two different sets, so maybe we didn't.  I was disappointed that I didn't get what I ordered.  Thanks for asking.  I wouldn't have said anything if you hadn't sent your email.  Have a fabulous day!
summary: I didn't get what I ordered.

reviewText:
I have invested a lot of time into these games. The features of the expansion seem great, however after 20 minutes of playing the program crashes. I've searched forums and reinstalled the game and gone through all of the troubleshooting.

Save yourself the headache with these games and expansions. They are buggy to the point of being unplayable.
summary: Buggy to the point of unplayable.

reviewText: The company does not care if your phone gets stolen and you can't access your account any longer. I played for a few months and fell in love with the game. Then my phone was stolen. The company blamed me and they were RUDE when I tried to remove my phone from the account and denied me access to my account and locked it permanently. I was banished for getting robbed. I will never buy another Square-Enix game.

Generally I really do enjoy Final Fantasy games, however my account was compromised shortly after release, and I've been trying to get it back ever since. It's been a back and forth for months now, and I'm finally just giving up. Definitely make sure you get the authenticator they offer with this game, because it's impossible to get your account back if you don't.
summary: Account was compromised after launch, support will not help recover.

reviewText: Don't buy this game if you're looking for something different.  It's just the same old boring run-of-the-mill themepark MMO.  There's absolutely nothing to recommend it.  I'm sorry I bought it and looking for a refund.  Play Aion for free instead.

Pre-ordered it and didn't receive early access.

Also, it's 830pm on launch day, and I still don't know anyone who's been able to get in a server yet.

If you haven't purchased this game yet, do a google search to make sure they fixed the server issues. If you're going to buy it today, you aren't going to be able to play.

The beta was pretty fun, but I can't give it any stars because no one can play it yet.
summary: They locked all the North American servers on launch day.

reviewText:
Don't pick up the game now if you plan on playing with friends, you'll both just end up on different servers because they get full and SE won't allow you to create a character on the same server as your friends.

Even if you do actually get on the same server, you'll end up stuck in a queue or get a "world is full" error and have to keep trying to get on to play.

I would wait a few weeks before picking this up...Customer support is horrendous at the moment also.
summary: Fun Game.....If you could actually log on.

reviewText: I downloaded this expansion pack and when I tried to install it onto my game, the game crashed. I had to reinstall the game and I still couldn't get it to work. Contacted Amazon support but not heard back as of yet. I am extremely disappointed.

I have a few other expansions that work perfectly, but when I installed this one the game refuses to load any more. I tried uninstalling it and then reinstalling but I get the same results, only now that I've uninstalled it everything I had done on there is gone. Now I have to re-reinstall my games that work and cry foul that I wasted my $50 that I spent on this worthless download.

Wow. The first one I received did not work on my PC... So I ordered another... And guess what? IT DOESN'T WORK. But I cannot return it now, it's been 30 days. So unless I can find a solution for this to work on my PC, it's garbage to me. Any solution would be appreciated.

I'm sorry to write a bad review on these, but I bought two of them (purple and blue) and both of them quit working within about a month (they were not abused or played with rough, either!). I bought the matching wii remotes with them (blue and purple) and both of those still work just fine - but the nunchucks don't. Not with the matching controllers, and not with the actual Nintendo wii remotes. I don't know what's wrong with these, but there must be some flaw. What a shame.

Bought this because I can't find Wii controllers anywhere. It turns on but won't sync with the Wii. I have tried several times, but can't get it to work. Terrible product for a terrible price considering it doesn't work at all.

If I could give it a 0 I would. I had bought this for my son (a green one) for his Wii and after about 2 weeks, it stopped working. We thought maybe it was just a fluke so we bought him another one (Red) and not even a week later that one stopped working. This is crap and poorly put together. Something is wrong with these and I see I'm not the only one that has this problem. It's sad because this was perfect for my son. But now I will take my money else where and buy a better quality controller.

I bought this as a gift for my child.  By the time she tried it out we couldn't get it to work.  It would connect to the Wii but we couldn't get past the start screen for Mario Kart, it locked up, no movement.  My friend who owns a Wii came over to try to get it to work but he couldn't either.  He said it seemed to be a poor copy of a real Wii controller, only works in certain modes.

This was an early christmas gift and when my son opened it he was so excited. He accidentally dropped it when he got off the couch but it wasn't too far from the floor and it wasn't a bad drop, but the remote is now broke and won't work. He only used this for an hour and now I have to buy him another one. Would not buy again.
summary: He accidentally dropped it when he got off the couch but it wasn't too far from the floor and it wasn't a bad drop, but the remo

reviewText:
This controller was great when I got it. It worked really well for the first two months until it randomly started to automatically look down as if I was holding down on the right thumb stick.

I'm really disappointed with this controller because I really liked it until it started to malfunction. I was going to return it but the return date expired 3 weeks before the controller started to act up.

Unfortunately I just opened this package and this is a dud. It does not work at all. Worst part is that because I waited so long to try it out, it is too late to return it. Pretty messed up. Not happy.

The company failed to list the CA Prop 65 warning on the description. Imagine my surprise when we received the box and it had the warning that "This product contains chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer and/or birth defects or other reproductive harm." Not something I literally want in the hands of my children. Will be returning.

I bought this item for my game machine but when I put it on some of the button controls wouldn.t work. I don't know if it was pressing on one of the buttons in the back or what the problem was. I did take it off and put it back on several times before I finally gave up.

The game has compatibility issues with Windows 8. Also, it forces you to download bloatware. If you refuse to download Windows Games Live on your computer, you won't be able to save the game.

Game is good, but compatibility and bloatware killed it for me.
summary: Compatibility issues and windows games live bloatware

reviewText: Rockstar has poor commitment to updating their products. This game is not compatible with Windows 8, Windows 8 Pro, Windows 8.1, or Windows 8.1 Pro. I know most new PCs come now with Win8 OS. So most of these PCs cannot play this game right out of the box. A lot of tweaks and work around has to be done to get it working fine. I still did not manage to get mine working. Stay away from all of Rockstar games if your OS is any version of Win8.

Aside from the fact it doesn't work on Windows 8 64-bit, it was always really poorly optimized for PC. I have all the games and when I was able to play them, I always found other games to play. The multiplayer was fun when I used parties, but other than that, San Andreas is a much better game. It's pretty forgettable, so just skip it.

I stopped using it the day after I got it. It is very difficult to use for gaming, as there really isn't a great way to grasp the mouse if you need to pick it up while scrolling during fast paced games. Really unsatisfied with it.

I love the mouse, but it's HORRIBLE in terms of the bugs it causes. First off, it will randomly lock the control button on the keyboard, then randomly some buttons will not work. Overall the worst experience I've ever had owning a mouse, and that's coming from years of experience.
summary: Great mouse, but LITTERED with bugs

reviewText: This mouse is cool while it lasts, if you are okay with the cursor jumping quite often. I do not recommend it though. The customer service is the worst I've ever seen. Their website is hard to navigate, their phone lines are always full, and they do not have a support email to contact.

Had played and been addicted to WoW for quite some time before I gave it up as it was taking up too much of my time. This was recommended to me as a game you can pick up and put down and still be awesome. Well, the putting it down part sure was easy. Played for a few days and just couldn't get into it.

I was quite excited for this controller. It had everything I wanted and needed. So when I got it today, I went tot ry it as soon as possible only to have it not turn on at all. I figured it was just a matter of the battery being low. So I plug it into a wall adapter to let it charge and the thing won't even take a charge, none of the LEDs even turn on. Dead on arrival.

I'm very disappointed. I paid full price, for a full Xbox 360 controller, charger, and battery.

And what do I get? A full controller, charger, and a dead, un-chargable battery. Which means you can't even sync it to a receiver because the charger blocks the sync button.

I know the controllers in general are very good, but my purchase has been a large disappointment.
summary: My purchase has been a large disappointment.

reviewText: Just hooked it up but it doesn't work. When I insert both NES and SNES games, the game starts up but the start button on the controller doesn't allow me to start the game. I tried both the NES and SNES controllers that came with it as well as some original controllers I had. None will let me start any games I tried to play. The unit is defective and will have to be returned. Huge disappointment.

This console is terrible.  The SNES cartridges don't appear to plug in quite right into the console.  We tried about 20 different SNES cartridges we have and none of them would work on it.  We had to return it the day after we received it.

I've tried numerous times to get this game to install on Windows 7, but each time I've been unsuccessful. I paid $2 for the game, but can't even get that much enjoyment out of it since I can't play it. Very frustrating since I enjoy a good fighting game.

I ENJOYED FF13. IT IS A GREAT GAME THAT I STILL PLAY TODAY. THE STORY, THE GRAPHICS, AND THE FIGHTS. THEN CAME FF13-2. DID NOT ENJOY THAT GAME EVEN A LITTLE. NOW THERE IS RETURN OF LIGHTNING. I AM SO IRRITATED THE WAY THIS GAME IS SET UP. THE TIMER IS A JOKE. THE GAME PLAY IS A JOKE. THE WHOLE GAME IS JUST A JOKE. I WOULD LIKE TO SEND IT BACK TO SQUARE ENIX FOR A FULL REFUND FOR THE GAME AND THE COLLECTORS EDITION BOOK. WAIT TILL IT HITS THE $20 BIN BEFORE YOU WASTE YOUR MONEY.

This game is a slap in the face to the Final Fantasy franchise.  I never heard of an 'JRPG' to where you have a time limit and get 0 experience points when you defeat enemies.  This game has a horrible camera, and battles are nothing but mashing buttons.  If you are looking for a great JRPG to play, get Ni No Kuni instead.

This was supposed to be a brand new product, and it wasn't! Not only did they send me a used one. It was dirty and the battery panels were rusted and it doesn't even work. This was supposed to be a sure purchase because it was from "Nintendo". What a piece of garbage. I'm really really disappointed.
summary: This was just gross. DO NOT BUY THIS!

reviewText: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my kids. It never worked. We tried different batteries, syncing the remote with the console, everything and we still couldn't get it to work. I should have returned it immediately. I meant to, but got busy and now it's been six months and I've missed the return window. So check what you order and make sure it works! If not, return it immediately and don't waste $25 like I did.
summary: The Remote they sent didn't work!

reviewText:
it does not work at all..i tried everything to connect it to my wii and still nothing..how do i make it work on my wii??

UPDATE:: This wii controller does not work.i tried everything to get it to work with my wii..i bought this controller so my family and friends could play 'just dance' together..i tried everything and i could not get this remote to work..i paid close to 40 bucks for this junk..

This doesn't work at all. I set it up and it will work for a few minuets then it just goes off. I set it up over and over for about an hour and it keeps shutting down or, the pointer does not work. I purchased several games for this remote and now they are just sitting on the shelf.

Been waiting for a long time for a Windows 7 compatible version of the game, paid $50, and Red Alert 2 doesn't work. At all. The start menu doesn't work. The intro movie doesn't load. You can't play the game. A total failure on the part of EA.

Just make a game that works. This is terrible, and someone should be fired. Do not buy this edition of the game.

almost my favorite mouse of all time.
Pinky rest is a huge plus for me and I can not get over how comfortable this mouse feels in my hand.

After using this mouse for a very short time the tracking became very inconsistent.
It became a battle to get my mouse to move where I wanted it to.

This is the only mouse that I would ever buy if it just worked correctly....
summary: almost my favorite mouse of all time

reviewText: I have loved this mouse. Never had an issue with it working until I updated my Mac OS 10.10. I can't go back to my previous OS, and Mad Catz support has completely ignored me. Even when I get a support ticket they give me a run around and won't just come out and tell me they've stopped supporting this mouse. It's been over a year now and I can't use it anymore. Too bad. If you're going to have a product support it.

This was the most uncomfortable mouse I ever used. There are a lot of adjustments available. I tried different positions, different parts, but nothing worked for me. There was no place to put my little finger, so I had to hold it up all the time. Very uncomfortable! Maybe for a smaller hand or a larger hand it'd work, but not for me.
summary: I couldn't make it work for my hand. Very uncomfortable.

reviewText: Contrary to what this says it isn't 100% compatible with Mac OS X. When it's plugged into my MacBook Pro(Late '14) the dock shuts off and you have no access to it until it's unplugged. I bought this and the Office R.A.T. M, both are not 100% OS X compatible. Needless to say I won't be buying their products again.
summary: Contrary to what this says it isn't 100% compatible with ...

reviewText: I had one of these keyboards for 2 years, the keys stopped working. I was looking for a new one and found this refurbished one for half the price of a new one. After 4 days of use all the keyboard keys stopped working. So this must be a flaw in this keyboard. Keyboards should last a long time and not only a few years and way more than 4 days. I would stay away from this manufacture.

This did not work at all. My husband is very tech savvy, and we have two computers that we tried it on, but it did not work at all. He tried installing several different types of software and a couple other things, but none of them helped. I'd also point out that, despite the picture showing a Microsoft logo, the product did not at all. Save yourself the trouble and buy a USB XBox 360 controller from Microsoft.

After following the instructions here in the reviews, I was unable to get my controllers to correctly sync to the wireless receiver. At best, they would connect for a few seconds and then start flashing again. I tried uninstalling the driver and re installing it, and this did not work. I tried troubleshooting online, but none of the fixes worked.

Bought this because I thought it would be easier to play Call of Duty on my PC. Installed it with the CD and it didn't work. Tried to manually install drivers and still didn't work. Windows would not recognize it and it never synced with my xbox controller. Very disappointed

Don't expect this product to work I just received it and it will not sync with my Microsoft 360 controller. If you go to the manufacturer's website there is no support page for this product [...]. Do not buy this. I'm running windows 7 64 bit.

I was able to install the drivers for this and it will connect to my XBOX 360 Wireless Controller but it disconnects and re-connects about every 30 seconds no matter how far the controller is from the receiver.

I guess there's a reason this was the cheapest one of these on Amazon.

I bought this product with the intention of playing it for hours with no end. It did not download and it almost caused my computer to crash. It says on the box that it would download on my Windows 7 model. I wish I could send it back.

I have purchased this game three times.  I know, call me a sucker but I really wanted it.  The first two would not even load.  The third one loaded but when I tried to play it said it crashed.  I have uninstalled and reinstalled four times but it just does the same thing.  I usually have no problem with games loading and I was really disappointed because this was supposed to have some games I really like on it.  I would not recommend this company to anybody.
summary: I would love it if it worked.

reviewText: This is NOT a pack of Giant Skylanders! This is a pack of Skylanders that can be played in the Skylanders Giant game. There is a big difference! Don't make the mistake I made and think that this is a pack of Giants.

This game doesn't even have a server browser in the game, it uses your internet browser. Then you have to install a plug-in, but it's not even a plug-in it's a seperate executable that just sits in the background all the time.  I can't believe how awful this is.  Do not purchase this game, don't even install it if it's free.  It's not worth it.

This is the second R.A.T.5 I've owned.  Both had issues with the left mouse button becoming unusable.  But funny enough, that isn't why this gets a 1 star review.  It's because of Mad Catz's customer service.  They are slow to respond, they give you the runaround, and it's just not worth it.  I'm done with Mad Catz products.
summary: But funny enough, that isn't why this gets a 1 ...

reviewText: No matter what I tried I couldn't get this cable to work, it just made my DS blink with a red light when it "charged." It didn't do anything bad to my DS but it also didn't charge my device either. Waste of money, but it was worth a shot.

Didn't work at all right out of the box. Poor quality control, I guess. Picked up a cable locally and it worked fine. Don't recommend buying online unless you have a lot of patience for dealing with returns.

Was excited to get this so I wouldn't have to carry my charger around, but unfortunately it doesn't work. Tried several different USB chargers (iPhone & iPad chargers as well as a few other ones that I use for various devices) and had zero luck.

I would give 0 stars if possible. Basically, I opened the package, tried to set up the system, but during syncing, I discovered the Gamepad's touchscreen is defective. To make sure I wasn't being stupid, I took it to Gamestop, who confirmed the findings. In case you don't know, a functional touchscreen is required to set up the system. This item was advertised as being 100% functional, but because of the defective touchscreen, it is 0% functional.

This unit didn't work out of the box.  I called customer service, who were and still are very nice.  They said it would need to be returned for repair. I sent it in the next day and was told that I could expect it back between 1 1/2 to 2 weeks after I ship it.  I shipped it April 22nd.  Today is May 20th and they are saying it is still in repair and they have no idea when it will be done.  I would recommend avoiding the system altogether.  If it doesn't work, it would appear that you're just out of luck.
summary: Good luck to you if it doesn't work.

reviewText: I don't know if i am just late to the party, but i can't find much support to get this to work right on my phone or computer. Which is a shame cause it is a great build quality for such a small controller.

These controllers I ordered, DO NOT WORK. Of course they turn on, but having a controller that always moves you down, because the joysticks don't work, DO NOT WORK. So needless to say. I cannot use these controllers. After sending a message to the seller, I haven't gotten any response. So do yourself a favor, buy a PS4, don't even bother with any of the wii u stuff.

I am a die hard fan of CoH, i waited a long time for this new sequel, i didn't know Sega would be involved in this game, they took the CoH title and crapped all over it, the game is nothing like the previous installment, its a shadow of what we are used to from CoH, also you won't be able to play the game, i couldn't even finish the first mission, it crashes and there are no efforts to fix these bugs and issues with the game, its a complete waste of money and i don't encourage anyone to buy this game.

Not really good. I want an HD remake of the original game. This has a level or two from the original, 2, and 3. It also has all the new techniques that didn't exist in the first game, so it's super easy to get the high scores in a few seconds on some of the levels. It's just not what I expected.

I can't really say that this thing works.  I expected to see 16x9 output on my HD TV, but the output is in 4:3 format.  Not sure if that is a limitation of my Wii.  I have a 1st generation Wii I believe.  In addition, there is no sound coming out of the TV, which I expect means there is no sound coming thru the HDMI connection with this thing, and it's not like I have an old tech TV, it is very new.  So that's two strikes.  I think I'm just going to have to return it as an unsatisfied customer.

Bought this thing on a Groupon deal because it was cheap, and it wasn't even worth the amount I spent on it there. Pairing it is a pain, and it's constantly unpairing itself. When it works it's actually a fine controller, but the time it actually does work is very short. Skip this one. If you really want to get a controller like this for your Wii U, just buy the official one from Nintendo.
summary: The old days of awful 3rd party Nintendo controllers are back

reviewText: I ordered this for Christmas.  When it finally got here I plugged it in to charge and when the light turned green tried to sync to the Wii and also the Wii U.  It wouldn't even turn on.  Charged it some more and left it plugged in.  Still nothing.  Requested a replacement.  It finally arrived (after being shipped for a second time) and the same thing is happening.  Returning it and getting a full refund.  Don't bother with this controller, it is not worth the time and the hassle.

I got this as a lightning deal, and I was very excited. Turns out that it doesn't work with most Wii U games. Not only did I have to return the first one because it didn't turn on, the new one didn't even work with the games I have. Then to take it a step further, when I tried to use it with Super Luigi U, it didn't respond but still took over the first player control so I had to restart the console. This controller was nothing but a frustration. Avoid it.

I would only (maybe) recommend this controller if you need a classic controller. If you need a wii mote, it's good unless you have a game that requires the nunchuck. As for the pro controller, DIDN'T work! I don't like writing bad reviews, but I bought 2 of these controllers and they both functioned the same way. They feel cheap but that didn't bother me. If it would have functioned as advertised (a 3 in 1) I would have kept them both.
summary: 1 1/2 in 1, not 3 in 1. Don't buy unless...

reviewText: Alright, so I first wrote a review about this mouse being amazing, and well it is.. when it works. I bought this mouse 6 months ago, but non of my computers/laptops will recognize this mouse anymore. I have to try to plug it in several times before it even detects it. I've tried downloading the drivers for this mouse, but it doesn't work.

I have yet to be able to play this game, mainly because I always have trouble playing games through my Steam connection.  If I had known that such a connection was necessary to play this game, I would never have purchased it.
summary: Accessing my game through Steam seems an unnecessary complication.

reviewText: This is like finding out Santa Claus isn't real. I am not going to be the uninformed consumer again!! This does not work. I jumped through all the hoops, and it still does not work. Why do you sell products that don't work?

DO NOT BUY IT IS CRAP DO NOT BUY IT IS CRAP DO NOT BUY IT IS CRAP DO NOT BUY IT IS CRAP DO NOT BUY IT IS CRAP very unhappy You should buy the disc instead I will be calling my bank to REFUND MY MONEY IF THEY DONT
summary: DO NOT BUY IT IS CRAP DO NOT BUY IT IS CRAP DO NOT BUY ...

reviewText: I WOULD LOVE TO WRITE A REVIEW ABOUT THIS GAME BECAUSE I LOVE ALL THE HER INTERACTIVE NANCY DREW GAMES. BUT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I CAN NOT DOWNLOAD IT!! I HAVE TRIED 10 DIFFERENT TIMES TO DOWNLOAD IT. IT DOWNLOADS AND THEN WHEN IT COMES TO INSTALLING, I GET NOTHING BUT ERROR MESSAGES THAT TELL ME EITHER ABORT RETRY OR IGNORE. THIS IS THE FIRST AND LAST TIME I BUY FROM AMAZON DOWNLOAD. I WANT A REFUND!

This mouse would be awesome except for one major flaw: sometimes the cursor "jumps" to a random point on the screen. I don't know why it does this. I have never had a mouse do such a strange thing. It makes it TERRIBLE FOR GAMING because you could be clicking on something repeatedly (think League of Legends or Diablo where you NEED PRECISION) and all of a sudden your cursor is on the other side of the screen. It screws you up big time.

I really hate to give it such a low score, because for a while it worked wonderfully, but.. I've owned it for only a few months and it's somehow become completely dysfunctional. Most of the keys have suddenly stopped working and no amount of troubleshooting seems to be helping anything. I don't know if mine was simply a randomly malfunctioning unit or of this is indicative of the product in general, but for the time being I really cannot recommend this product.

i got this and it does not even work. my computer does not even recognize it. i tried it on two different computers and it still does not work at all. if you are looking for a keyboard that is functionable, then do not buy this piece of s***

I bought this keyboard thinking it was going to be a good keyboard. I use it for work and I am in IT so I have a lot of typing that I do so I wanted to get a keyboard that I could make it work for me. Well, I was typing on it and the legs on the back came off and the arrow button don't work will if you change them out with the blue arrow keys. So I will be looking for a new keyboard and I have just had this for a little bit over a month.

The overall story is boring. Game-play is repetitive. The learning curve is high, and most of the time I had no idea what I was doing or what I was suppose to do. And there is too much grinding to really start to move things along. Remember to watch a game-play video before you buy. I personally recommend the game SMT IV for 3DS, much better than this game.

I bought these as an addition to the Nintendo 3DS that I purchased for my grand daughter. I love the fact that it came in colors, as I have three grand daughters, so I was able to purchase a different color for each child. This way there is no arguing about which system belongs to whom.

Came as advertised, charger seems to work great but the battery will not hold a charge.  I charged it for 4 hours, used it for 30 minutes, then turned it off. The next day the battery was completely dead. It won't hold a charge at all. I am really upset because I have no money for any more batteries for my controllers.

Product did not work right out of the box. Lights up red when I first put the batteries in but the light only stays on for a few minutes then goes out. It will not charge at all. I must have gotten a defective one. Returning it tomorrow.

Everything was working fine for about  a month. Then it just started to malfunction. When the battery dies and I try to charge it, it says that it's fully charged.

Another problem is that now it only charges on one side. This is the third Microsoft OEM charging station I've bought.

I decided to finally just buy the plug n play which actually works without a hitch. It's been about 3 months with the plug n play and it still works like a beast.
summary: Good when it used to work properly

reviewText: I loved the original Bioshock! It was my favorite game. This game just really isn't good. At first it was interesting but then it quickly became repetitive and the story was lacking. I thought the ending was just terrible!
summary: Not what I thought it would be

reviewText: There seems to be a 2 second delay between when you sing and when you hear yourself. I tried different settings but couldn't figure out what's wrong. It's very annoying so my boys don't want to play with it.

Had a hard time getting it to work.  Once it did work, I found I had to constantly recalibrate before it finally quit working completely.  I don't see how someone could finish a game let alone a level with this thing.  Basically it's like controlling your mouse with a toy so you're not really aiming at anything.  What a joke.  Not even fun for 1 minute.  You're better off getting a racing wheel.  I should have known better.

I ordered this with the impression that I would be able to play it on my Windows Surface tablet using the Windows 10 compatibility function for older games. This hasn't been the case, so I have this game that I can't play. Maybe I will find the fix for it, or it could just be that instead of using it on a Surface Tab with Windows 10, I need to use it on a computer. Either way, currently, I haven't been able to play the game.
summary: It won't play on Surface Tab with Windows 10

reviewText: It wasn't compatible with my 3DS so I updated the software. Then I found out that the Action Replay supposedly can't be used on the 3DS anymore (even though the product is sold as being 3DS compatible). After I updated the software I tried to use it on a DS but it can't be used on the DS after updating it and I can't undo the update.
summary: It wasn't compatible with my 3DS so I updated the ...

reviewText: Even if you get this thing to work on your system, it probably doesn't work with the games you have. it advertises that it works with the 3DS, but there are no codes for the games that you have...any of them. Save your money and buy a Prima guide.

I thought there would be no problem with this product, but I was let down. I turned it on and nothing happened. The screen just goes white. I have tried everything from updating the firmware to trying different 3ds systems.

I purchased this to play the Klondike game. When I play it, I like the option of flipping one card at a time. However, this version only allows you to do that for one hand! What a stupid and arbitrary limitation! It ruins the game!

I really wanted this one might I add it's cute and I never had one before so I was excited. I ordered this brand new and it wasn't, it came used and a little after a week it crapped out on me. I'm re-turning it and getting my money back. I'm really disappointed I was so happy to get this and now I have to return it because it came used.

This product has terrible picture quality, I don't know how to describe how its bad. It just has terrible lighting. I bought 2 of these and they both have the same problem. Spend your money on something else. You can get better picture quality on a 10 year old TV

this product was not good at all it was a little bit too big forward the screen so I had to cut it to make it fit and when it was on the screen the touchpad wouldn't work so I had to take it off. did not recommend

Beware, you're about to overpay by $20. Like many people, I paid for this Nuketown bundle ($59.99), only to learn that Amazon is currently selling a regular version of BO2 for $39.95, but that regular version includes NUKETOWN as well. I've complained to Amazon, and all they can offer is a $10 rebate on a $20 loss. Live and learn. Just don't buy this bundle.
summary: Do Not Pay for this Nuketown bundle, It's FREE for everyone

reviewText: Do not buy this mouse. The scroll wheel is awful. I have had this mouse for a little over 3 months and the scroll wheel will not scroll properly in one direction, but instead it will "stutter" scroll backwards every time. It started off doing this gradually, an irritation for sure, but not impossible to work with; by now it has become useless to play any game with because it can not perform any action with the scroll wheel reliably. This is a shame because it is one of the few left-handed mice available.

I'm not sure why this is marketed as an ergonomic mouse. There is very little about this mouse that is actually ergonomic. I bought this because I have Carpal Tunnel (CT) and Ulnar Collateral Ligament (UCL, a thumb RSI) in my right hand. I used this mouse for a few hours at work, and soon began to have terrible pain, especially in my thumb. Returning this for a refund.

Not a good purchase. I'm done with Razer. This is my second Razer mouse where the middle mouse button died within a year.

The scroll wheel button will stop working within a year. To fix it you just have to pound on it for awhile, sorta like "spamming" the button. Then it will start working again for awhile, until you need to spam it again. It's bizarre. This is the second Razer mouse I've had that did this same thing.

Check out another brand. The quality of these is horrible.
summary: Your middle mouse button will die, complete garbage

reviewText: Mid button broke after 8 months, don't buy this product, i don't recommend also i have been contacted with Razer and they didn't help me.
summary: MID BUTTON NOT WORKING, Razer's Customer Service Didn't Help.

reviewText: This device doesn't work on my computer at all.  I'm so disappointed in this product. I tried everything to make it work but nothing. And what gets me is that it states it will work on my computer but it doesn't.
summary: I'm so disappointed in this product

reviewText:
This controller is a piece of crap.

It isn't compatible with any games I've played yet. The support it has is terrible. No rumble features, and some of the buttons are mapped in two places. I.e down on the D-pad is the same as pressing the A button in some games, etc etc. Get a different controller, don't even bother with this one.

Don't buy it.  Just don't.  I'm running it in Windows 7 on a 2 year old machine. Autosave doesn't work - even if I run it as Admin.  If I quit, I have to create a new profile and start from scratch.  If I die, the game freezes.  I haven't been able to get past chapter one - and won't, because I'm sick of the frustration.  I went to EA's support site - they don't even support the game anymore and it was only released in 2011.

Save yourself the money and aggravation.  Find another game.

i have a pretty powerful computer and this game froze it completely, i never got a chance to play it and now i don't want to. i uninstalled it as soon as i was able to get my computer going again. if i could give it less than one star i would.

I needed a replacement adapter to charge my Wii U,I ordered this one and it died in less than a year. I just ordered a second one because I wasn't sure the first one was dead and sure enough it was,we'll see how long the second one lasts!!
summary: I needed a replacement adapter to charge my Wii U ...

reviewText: Bought this keyboard through Amazon, and I really do like it. However, after having it just a month and a half, the LED in the F12 key stopped working, and the '-' key on the numerical keypad isn't working at all. Of course, since it's been a month and a half since I bought it, Amazon tells me I can't return it, so there's nothing I can do.
summary: A few things stopped working soon after I bought it

reviewText:
I have tried multiple times to download and install this game and it does not work every single time. Its not my computer, my computer is an excellent computer that is 2 days old.

HUGE WASTE OF MONEY!!!
summary: my computer is an excellent computer that is 2 days old

reviewText:
This game is such a complete disappointment, quite possibly the worst purchase I have ever made in my life.

The developers have completely removed all of the fun elements from the previous Empires games, I bought in the hopes of enjoying a continuation of a great game from my childhood, however this completely missed the mark.  I forced myself to play the game for far longer than I would have liked, but I had to try to give it a chance.  It failed.
summary: This game is such a complete disappointment, quite possibly the worst purchase I have ever ...

reviewText: Once you find out how to even get the game to work, it's so full of bugs you cant even play it. I'm not able to kill a boss in the beginning, and nothing works, so the game isn't playable and there is no one around to help or fix this. I've always been a huge fan of fable and this is just sad.
summary: I've always been a huge fan of fable and this is just sad.

reviewText: So, the game itself isn't bad....if you don't glitch.  I had so many issues with glitches in this game that it made it impossible to complete the game.  For example, at random, I stopped being able to interact with anyone or anything.  Options just were no longer there.  Some quests are just...not completable because of this (chicken races, for instance, wouldn't register).
