I sincerely wish I could get a refund on this, because this was one of the worst game purchases I have ever made.

This is my second PLYR headset from Skullcandy, and like most of their products the sound quality is very good, clear and loud with impressive bass. HOWEVER both of the headsets I had (PLYR1 and PLYR2) both suffer from inferior build quality. I had both headsets brake in the same place, right where the earpiece mounts to the frame, if they used a metal bracket instead of plastic it would not have this problem, and for $100(PLYR2) and $200 (PLYR1) I expect better build quality.
summary: Great sound quality, poor build quality

reviewText: I don't know what EA was thinking with this game. There are so many bugs in it you can't believe it. It is insulting to us consumers that they actually release a product this flawed. I can not recommend this game. It is not worth anywhere near what they are charging for it. Just pass on this one. If you are listening EA Games, take this back to the drawing board and see if you can get it right.
summary: Bug ridden waste of money and time

reviewText: Mine stopped working almost exactly a month after getting it. I noticed some other reviews also saying that their mouse stopped after 2-3 weeks of use. I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one with this issue and I hope it can be resolved.

VERY IMPORTANT: Unless you want to get banned from PlayStation Network, for using a Modded Controller, DO NOT BUY! Using a Modded Controller IS a violation of the Terms of Service.
BTW, who in their right mind would pay close to $100 or more, for an overpriced piece of junk like this? Modded Controllers might as well be called Cheaters Controllers.
summary: OVERPRICED PIECE OF JUNK! DO NOT BUY THIS CONTROLLER!

reviewText: I recently purchased this game and tried for 4 days to get it downloaded.  I never did get it downloaded and when I asked Amazon for help in doing so, they would not give me the information that I needed.  I will not order from them again.

The only thing cool about this game is how much money it generates for Disney.  I cannot, for the life of me, figure out the point of a game where you go out and buy expensive pogs just to have the ability for that pog to do the same thing as all the pogs you had before... especially when that thing, building stuff, isn't that interesting in the first place.  Maybe I am old, but I'll take Mario over this any day.
summary: Pointless waste of time and money

reviewText: My husband accidentally scratched the kids game and it wouldn't work even after taking it to be "fixed". We had no other option but to buy a new one. If you have priced this game it isn't cheap and you have to buy all of the characters with it. So we turned to Amazon and found this one used for a good price. Unfortunately it didn't work which was very disappointing. We did take it to be "fixed" and they were able to get it to finally work.

Right now my 13 year old nor 11 year old want anything to do with it. They want to play this game together, but for now can't figure out how. I am not a gamer so I can't help them and instructions don't come with the game (at least not mine). I hope this wasn't a waste of money, because it wasn't cheap. I will change my rating if they ever use it.

This game is one of the worst video games I've ever owned. It's pretty and that's the only good thing about it. It is so unrealistic and poorly put together it reminds me of games from PS1. It's not user friendly at all. All this game is good for is giving you a headache.

.. the R1 button stopped working. No matter what I did, it wouldn't register when I pressed it. I much prefer the Xbox 360 shape of the controller, but if the buttons don't work then it's useless to me. I threw it out. I won't risk buying another. Such a shame too, because it felt so good in my hands. Very unfortunate.
summary: I wanted to like it, but...

reviewText: This is definitely not good quality. It came in when it was supposed to but it is terrible. We have been trying to figure it out since Christmas and still can't get it to work. I would never had bought this if I knew it was going to be such a pain to figure out. I would not recommend this product EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We have spent weeks trying to get this game to work. Customer support is terrible. Have tried 6 different gaming computers all with different hardware and none of them can run this game. We have over 500 games in our library and this is only the second game we have not been able to finish due too so many bugs/issues.
summary: We gave up on this game :(

reviewText: I usually buy and download my games from GamersGate, but when the game was first released, GamersGate didn't have it. I downloaded it from here and it WOULD NOT OPEN after an hour spent downloading it onto my computer. The game just would close as soon as I hit the play button. I thought it was a problem with my computer. 3 months later, I bought a brand new Mac, spent an hour downloading it and it STILL did the same thing. It's now on GamersGate. Buy it from there! Not Amazon!
summary: I wish I could give this ZERO stars

reviewText: I've been trying to play this game since I've purchased it and haven't been able to get it to work for longer than 10 minutes. I literally have to save the game obsessively due to insanely frequent crashes. Even after the game update, the game still crashes ALL THE TIME and I mean ALL THE TIME!!! I've clocked it and I usually get about 8 minutes of running time prior to a crash. It's worth the extra wait to just order the game through the mail. At least that way it will work!

Amazon needs to offer an E-version of this card like they do for other forms of console credit because paying more than face value for a card like this is a total rip-off.

I know it is my choice to buy it or not, but this just seems like such a slap in the face to the consumer that I had to say something. Shame on you seller.
summary: Total rip-off - a $20 card needs to cost $20, not $28.

reviewText:
Great headset with one downfall.

The headset automatically shuts itself off on me every minutes. Doesn't matter how high the volume is. The only way around this is if you're chatting. So if you want to quietly watch a movie or play a game, it is going to turn off all the time. It's VERY annoying. What a shame you can't turn that feature off.

I ordered this after I read that it had a huge capacity and would last three times as long as the original battery in my gamepad. The battery did not even last two hours and does not hold a charge even when the gamepad is not on. I fully charged it and let it sit overnight and when I turned it on again the battery was dead anyway, despite not being turned on.

Bandfuse has been orphaned by its maker, who has closed its doors. There will be no more DLC (not that there was much to begin with). The game is dead. Yes, you can still play it, but there will never again be any updates or new songs. As such, you'd be a fool to buy it now.

The mouse looks and feels good. The problem is the software and firmware. The software is a complete mess, and if you make a firmware update, the mouse will do weird things, specially with the leds. I wouldn't recomend this product to anyone. I will never buy another gaming product from Corsair.

I adjusted the video settings and the shaders on and off and took forever to update the shaders, so I quit out of the game and next time i ran it it was just a black screen. My video card is a GeForce 9800 GTX+, I've run many games on it without a problem.
Now I have to uninstall the stupid game and reinstall it again to see if it works.

Normally, I have had very good luck with Logitech products but this mouse as good as it was rated just failed on me with less two months of use on it. I am not even going to bother trying to get a warranty replacement as it will probably crap out just as fast as this one did. It irks me to no end when you pay good money for a product these days that does not hold up the way it should (as was advertised). I will NOT recommend this product to anyone!!!
summary: Product Failed In Less Than 2 Months

reviewText: The instructions for downloading this game from "steam" do not make sense and are probably outdated.  I could not figure out how to download the game and I have demanded a refund.  You can go to "steam" and purchase the game directly from them without the hassle from amazon.

The sound quality was good. It never really fit my head very well, so a little uncomfortable. I've had this for 6 months now, and the headphone piece broke off making it totally unusable. I was just trying to adjust it, as it was uncomfortable, and it broke. Good sound quality, but doesn't matter if you can't wear it anymore. Would not recommend.
summary: The sound quality was good. It never really fit my head very well

reviewText: This is an awesome product especially for the price that I paid for it. But the item I received didn't have all the adequate parts and accessories for the headset to function properly. So I have to try and find the correct cords so that I can use my headset which is a little bit disappointing.

The controller arrived missing the part that plugs into the Xbox. The packaging was torn up and taped back together, which wouldn't be a problem if there were not parts missing. It's going to cost me more to ship it back than it's worth. So I either have to buy the part or throw the controller away. Complete rip-off.

Update: I ordered a new plug, which was pretty inexpensive. I've been using this controller and I do like it because I have small hands and this fits me better than a larger controller.

This mouse is awful. Do not buy it. It's advertised as a wired/wireless mouse, but when I use it in wired mode it freezes, disconnects, and stops working every 10 seconds. While it works fine in wired mode, what am I supposed to do when I want to charge it and use the computer at the same time? Stay away from this mouse!
summary: While it works fine in wired mode

reviewText: I bought this because it has a mic, but my computer won't detect the mic on the headset. I have spent hours trying to fix it but all I can find is that it may be plugged into the wrong spot, but it certainly is not.

This headphones are uncomfortable. The material they're made out of feels like a shag carpet when you put them on your ears. Logitech makes some great products, but stay away from all headphones. They're garbage.
summary: The material they're made out of feels like a shag carpet when you put them on your ...

reviewText: Today, after almost exactly 6 months of use, I can only hear from the left side of the headphones. My husband bought these as well, and his headphones are having the exact same problem after 6 months. I wouldn't buy these unless you want to replace them every 6 months.
summary: Today, after almost exactly 6 months of use, ...

reviewText: I bought this mouse a while back and I hate it. The battery life is garbage, it gives you no warning of any kind when the battery is running low or about to die, the only way to charge it is to hook it up to the thick cable, which is an inconvenience for me considering where my PC case sits in relation to my desk, and it doesn't seem to charge with the PC off, which means that more than half the time, it's basically a wired mouse. Avoid this.

Decent sound, mic, and cable.  However this counts for nothing due to the fact that these tend to move around on your head and eventually pinch your ears a bit so that it is uncomfortable to wear these for more than a few minutes.  I have bought two sets, one for me and one for my son.  We both feel the same way, that the ear pads are too stiff and unforgiving for long lasting comfort.  I have waited several months before writing this review since I really wanted to like these.
summary: Look elsewhere for comfortable head phones

reviewText:
Avoid this game.

Blizzard is milking this IP, yet the current Blizzard is not the original group of people who made the prequels.

Garbage game, far from originals. They're tricking you into thinking you're buying the same quality product.

If this game didn't have a giant "Blizzard" sticker on it, nobody would buy it.

This game seemed cool for about 15 minutes then it got super boring! The graphics are amazing and it looks beautiful. The only problem is that it's so bland. There is nothing new about this game. It's a standard fps.

This came as a free download with my PS4, and I still regret getting this game.... Single player is okay at best, and multi-player is god-awful. Seriously, this is the worst console multi-player I have played in years. I'm not sure what the other reviewers are smoking if they think this game even holds a candle to Battlefield 4.

If I haven't made it bleedin' obvious already, this game is terrible, DO NOT BUY IT!!!
summary: Free game and it STILL wasn't worth the money...

reviewText: There is a reason this game received poor reviews from most websites, it's boring. It's extremely repetitive. The graphics are ok, but not great. Oh, and it's a little too difficult, although that would be fine if it was actually fun, but sadly it's not.

Maybe you should rent this till the price goes down. I don't think this game is worth it and it's sad because I wanted to like it so much. I don't think it's terrible but it's not worth 60 bucks. Maybe 20 or 10 though.

Lame game, I mean, I love kids games, but this is lame even for a kid, I really don't get why people gave it 5 stars, maybe they are sony fanboys, I don't know. But I do have one excelent recommendation: Don't buy this game before you actually get a chance to play it first, rent it, borrow it from a friend, then after you spend a couple hours with it, choose wether you like it or not.
summary: Worst PS4 Launch Title (DON'T BUY IT)

reviewText: While much fun at first, you start doing the same mission and strike over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again.

Bought this for my daughter for christmas and have had nothing but problems with it since New Year's Day. It is constantly shutting itself off and won't turn back on for quite some time. Since I bought it in October I can't return it now even though technically only used it since Christmas Day.

If you really enjoy a first-person shooter in which enemies constantly spawn in endless numbers and you have NO COVER whatsoever to protect yourself in, or you like getting killed over and over and over again to the point that it's ridiculous, then this game is for you.

My son wanted to be frugal, so he ordered a used controller. I told him, "I didn't think that was a good idea" and it wasn't. As I suspected the item didn't work, he was so disappointed. The Amazon return process and credit was great!! He ordered a brand new controller from Amazon and was happy.
summary: "I didn't think that was a good idea" and it wasn't

reviewText: Once it updated, it wouldn't turn on. It would beep, and nothing would happen. I understand this is an issue with some PS4s. I sent it back and set up the PS3 again. I'll wait for them to figure out how to stop that from happening before I buy another.
summary: Brand new out of the box it didn't work.

reviewText: i have yet to buy this, but i think it's pretty lame the prices keep fluctuating on this. it was just $379.99 and it just jumped to $399.95. It's like they're trying to force these bundles down our throats. I don't want those games. I'm waiting for the price to drop so I can purchase my bundle-free PS4.
summary: but i think it's pretty lame the prices keep fluctuating on this

reviewText:
No clue how to contact the manufacturer - but I received this a couple days ago and it DOES NOT WORK.

Didn't come with a cable and my current one will not work with it.

So either I got a defective one or something.

My 4-year-old son loves Mario Kart, so we thought we would rent this and give it a try.  The controls are the same as other driving style games, but the graphics are C+ at best, and, while it has your favorite Turbo characters, they rarely are seen or heard from.  Because of the low quality graphics, it's very easy to get turned around and not know which way you are supposed to go.  If anyone is interested in this, try renting it first before you buy it.

My sister bought this on Amazon Prime. It arrived within 1 day but was dead on arrival. It doesn't light up. Changing the batteries does nothing. There were also no instructions. Its basically just a piece of useless plastic.

Trying to figure out how to return it and get our money back...

I don't know what to say.  This is the most I've ever spent on a game that I didn't finish.  And I don't think I even played it for more than two hours.  If I ever go back to it and it turns out to be good, I'll update this review.  But as of now....maybe the worst $50-$60 I've ever spent.
summary: Can't think of a game I bought and didn't finish....other than this one.

reviewText: I bought these for my daughter to use while gaming.  They worked great and she loved them.  After two weeks, the microphone stopped working.  I replaced them with the same item and the new pair lasted only two days before one of the headphones stopped working.  I bought a different brand and they have been working fine for the past three months.

We got this for our grandson who lives in another state. It came quick which was great. But it didn't work. Now we have to deal with the hassle of returning it and getting another one. Defective stuff. Hoping it all works out. I will update if it works out.

I couldn't wait to get this game after finding out that it was from the makers of 1000 Doors, but I could not get it to download correctly. I have two computers and couldn't get it to work on either. It looks like it could be a great game but just be aware that if you buy it, you might just be throwing your money away. Very disappointed.

This product doesn't work.  It also shows that it cannot be refunded. Don't waste your money on something that doesn't work straight out of the box.  How anyone got one that even worked for a short while is beyond me.

Can't really comment on the game due to the fact that we haven't been able to install it. Requires an origin account and the website will not allow us to create an account. Have tried on multiple pc's with no luck.

JUNK!

It works, but it feels like i'm going to break this thing every time I pick it up.  It is made with the absolute cheapest materials I have ever seen.

Here's the worst part:  It's too short.  I was expecting the same length as the original.  Don't expect to play while charging with this thing unless you use an extension cord.  If your original charger still works, don't bother with this.  Buy the 8 hour battery for $40 from Nintendo instead.

Warning, if you have a 16:10 monitor, i.e. for example, one that runs a resolution of 2560x1600 or 1920x1200, do NOT buy this game. The game only supports 16:9 monitors. Instead, if you try to run it on a 16:10 monitor, you will end up with huge black bars on the top and bottom of your screen which is completely unacceptable. It is basically a clear indication of a bad console port. It would have taken the developers 10 minutes to add this aspect ratio, but they were too lazy to bother.

This has got to be one of the worst games I've played. The controls are just horrible. I played AC Syndicate and loved it. The ship controls in Black Flag are terrible as are the characters controls on land. The climbing controls had me randomly jumping off the sides of buildings. I don't know what happened in the development of this game but they screwed it up.

I fell victim to one of several game breaking bugs that have made this game unplayable. If you intend to purchase it wait for a while and get it when it's on sale and after the bugs have been patched.

Update: I don't know if the bugs were patched, I don't really care. After I got my refund I gave up on this game permanently. Not worth it.
summary: Gamebreaking Bugs render the game unplayable

reviewText: Terrible.  As a fan of the first Rome Total War game, I eagerly awaited this game for months and pre-ordered it.  When it arrived I immediately installed it and connected it to my Steam account.  The first week it was literally unplayable.  After 2 months and and 7 major patches the game is still boring and glitchy.  I finally realized this game is never going to meet my expectations and I've uninstalled it from my hard drive.  It really is not a fun experience.  Save your money.

I was warned about this one, but I still went for it. I got the PC version, if it makes a difference. The movement is so bad that you spend all your time just trying to kill something as opposed to actually playing the game. I can play Halo and F.E.A.R. just fine on my computer with the same mouse and normal settings. I'm really bummed. I was excited for this one.
summary: Be great if I could play it

reviewText:
This is not usable as a gaming mouse. It has some serious issues where it 'stutters' as you move it across the screen. Not sure if this is a sensitivity issue of the laser or the communication with the wireless dongle. Either way it does not work as a gaming mouse. Also, you cannot map the side buttons in any game I have come across. Other reviews confirm this as well.

It is cheap and there is a reason it is so cheap.
summary: Not usable as a gaming mouse.

reviewText: This is horribly designed.  I fought my way though a level to the boss fight, then realized I needed a different weapon load-out.  After going back to the hub and going back to the level I found out I had to go through the entire level over again, which requires a weapon load-out different from the one for the boss fight.
summary: Don't buy this at any price

reviewText: This is a "superman" game so if you like flying/gliding and running up the sides of buildings, you will love it. I don't like those things, and the rest of the game is not very interesting because you don't need cars, airplanes, or any other form of transportation. Weapons are too weird and too powerful.
summary: Not at all like the previous Saint's Rows

reviewText: This is a PS3 controller, not PC.  If you want to make it work on PC you will need to download the necessary drivers to use a PS3 controller on PC which is not exactly user friendly AND you must use the included USB cable.  This controller does NOT function as a wireless bluetooth PC controller.
summary: This is a PS3 controller, not PC. If ...

reviewText: This has to have been the worst game I have ever tried. I couldn't believe how awful the graphics were and the game play made me feel like I had just broken out my Nintendo and turned it on. It was a total waste of money.

I paid 20 dollars for this game and it came to my house completely scratched up.  The Xbox would not play the disk.  I am very upset about this.  The disk will be going back to the seller and I will not be purchasing from them again.  I am appalled that the seller would send defective, completely useless merchandise to a customer.  I would not recommend buying from them if you are in any hurry to receive quality merchandise.

When we tried to use this disc, it didn't work and was giving us error messages. I wasn't sure if it was my new Xbox or something else. We went to Best Buy and bought another one and it worked great. So now I will be trying to do my first return on Amazon, hope that goes well.
summary: Love the game, however this one didn't work

reviewText: Bought this for my 2 boys, and to play multiplayer mode, you have to have an HDTV. Otherwise, you have to play single player. They don't warn you about this at all. If I had known this, I wouldn't have bought it.

This controller came out of the box with problems.  I feel like the quality of this controller was not the same as I expected from DualShock 3.  The paddles are more rigid and the battery doesn't last as long as my other controllers.
summary: I feel like the quality of this controller was not the same ...

reviewText: While I DO like the controller itself, I DO NOT like that it doesn't come with a cable for charging the battery. I find it ridiculous that a controller that costs as much as this does, doesn't come with a cable for using it.

I play a lot of hidden picture games, but this one simply doesn't work properly. The hints are not helpful when you get stuck and I wasn't able to do certain areas. Finally gave up on playing this game. It just doesn't make for a fun game experience. The story line seems interesting, but the story line means nothing if you can't finish the game.

When this game eventually works, go ahead and buy it. But until then AVOID AT ALL COSTS. DO YOU HEAR ME? AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!!!!

Oh and i LOVE that after buying it for 59.99 it's now 39.99. GREAT! They realized it's so damn bad they can't even sell it at full price for more than a month!!!

I have not EVER in my life been so enraged by a computer game. F@ck this game and F@ck the people who rushed it out the door before it was ready.
summary: AVOID AT ALL COSTS UNTIL IT IS FIXED

reviewText:
Horrible.

My computer is pretty comfortably above the minimum requirements and this game is nearly unplayable. And I'm glad to see its not my fault, judging by so many people having similar experiences.

I want my money back. If I don't get my money back or have this game actually run, I won't be buying another EA/Origin game.

Buggy as S***

I bought this game on sale, and I have to say that I actually regret it at this point. I'm trying to run it on very capable computer with a Nvidia GTX 770 on it, and it is simply not playable. The game is incredibly glitchy, will not open in full screen mode, and just does not look right. I'm sure that they'll improve and make it better, but this is simply unacceptable that this game was released in this state.

This game looks great, but it crashes 50% of the time.  The game has been out now for 2 months and they've yet to fix the game.  All my other games work just fine, so I know it's not my computer.  If you're on the fence, I would pick the game up if it was less than < $20, otherwise I would wait until they reprogrammed it, and pick it up even cheaper.  They really should've spent another 3-6 months to polish this game up and make sure everything was working before releasing it.
summary: Crashes all the time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Fire the halfwit exec who rushed this.

reviewText: I was only able to play 3 games without crashing it's a great game if you could play it without this issue. I crashed about 15 times and was only able to play 3 games without crashing but in those 3 games it's very laggy and the sound keeps going on and off. I'm going to wait for a few weeks and see if they will fix this and then change my review.
summary: Crashing to desktop is not fun

reviewText: This game is a waste of time and money. The tutorial which is required takes too long. Once you finally finish it and start to play the game, there is no way to save it. Each time you play you have to start the boring tutorial again. AND Amazon will not refund your money.
summary: BAD PRODUCT! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

reviewText: Don't buy this or anything from this company.  It is made of cheap plastic, the remotes do not fit in it properly and it does not charge.  I tried to return it and they are requiring me to pay return shipping.  Return shipping is going to cost as much as the product in the first place.  Don't buy this is junk!

The game is very good as are all the ones in this series.  But, unfortunately, I will not buy another in this series if I have to sign up with "STEAM" in order to run the game.  STEAM slows down the game, it is confusing, user unfriendly and time consuming.  In short it has taken away the fun of playing this game.  Let me know when this game is offered without the requirement to download STEAM.
summary: The game is ok, it's the requirement that one has to sign up for "STEAM" that makes it diffgicult and terribly slow.

reviewText: Couldn't even install it on my computer (2016 MacBook Air). I tried and tried, looked up every article I could find on the internet, uninstalled and reinstalled...I couldn't get it running even once. To top it all off, by the time I went through this whole process the return window had expired so I can't even get my money back. Don't waste your money!

I'm not a gamer, just a 65 year old man who wanted something to play so I thought that this would be perfect as it receives high praise.  I was wrong.  In the game you don't do anything other than going here and there and then do it again...and again.  The people you meet speak in jibberish and I just don't get the point of it.  It's just sitting on my desk now.  Luckily it only cost me $20.
summary: just a 65 year old man who wanted something to play so I thought that this would be perfect as it receives high praise

reviewText:
Not my cup of tea. It's too hard, a bit too Japanese for me. If I can't have fun in a game within the first 3 hours I shelve it. I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone really, unless you are a hardcore fan of JRPG's.

I enjoy difficult games, like the Dark Souls series, Bloodborne etc. I have control over my character and how I progress. Those games take a bit of skill. This game just seems random.
summary: If I can't have fun in a game within the first 3 hours I ...

reviewText: I didn't buy the game from amazon, but it still sucked and I will tell you why. This game wasn't good at all, it didn't make much sense as to why things were happening, it had a lot of potential that was wasted. The story line itself didn't make much sense as to where it takes you and why. I don't recommend it at all.

I purchased this game thinking it was a 3rd person game and when I found out it was a first person game I find that very annoying with a controller. I traded the game in for the price I paid for it so I'm happy.
summary: Would rather own the game on a PC!

reviewText: I bought this as a gift for a friend, but I ended up having to replace it after finding out that the discs were defective.  I returned it for a replacement thinking that the new one should be fine, but the replacement was still defective.  I just ended up taking the gift back and returning it.

I want to like this game, I really do. But I got motion sickness within 5 minutes of playing this game. The camera is just way to close to Batman. From what I've read online, it's probably due to the field of vision (FOV) is just too small. This is the first game in my 20+ years of gaming that gave me motion sickness. Maybe I'm just getting old. It's a shame because I really enjoyed the Arkham series and I really want to play this game.

I bought this game before Christmas thinking I was also going to get an XBox360. We could not get an XBox until the end of February. By the time my son got to try the game it was to late to return. The game gets stuck in the same place and he has to start over. As far as I am concerned this was a waste of $60.00. He really wants to. Get another one but I am not going to pay again for the same game.

This is without a doubt, the worst game i have played in the last 5 years. It is so terrible i would laugh, but I'm too busy crying about how i spent $20 on it. Waste of money, waste of time, waste of GB space. Don't buy this; save your money, and save yourself

I'm having to send this product back. When I first read the reviews I was a little wary over how many people were complaining about one side of the headphones not working. I went ahead and purchased it anyways, and now I'm having to send it back for that very issue. I'm giving this one more chance, but if I get another one that doesn't work or breaks within a week or so then I'm moving on to a different product. Be wary!
summary: Did not work when I received it

reviewText: I loved FarCry 3, I hate Blood Dragon. I understand that it's trying to imitate an old video game, but it fails miserably. It's not worth even $15.00. After I installed it, I could no longer play FarCry 3, so I uninstalled Blood Dragon and now I can't install FarCry3. This Blood Dragon is a complete waste of time and money.

I ordered this, hoping to replace my old cable that is in the midst of not working, but when it came, nothing. I plugged it in and the television still says "no signal". I tried a different television and the same thing. I hope to get at least two years with this cable, but I didn't get to have a second. Sad to say, I'm not happy at all with my purchase. I'm going to send it back tomorrow (at the time of this review). I'm going to look elsewhere for a Nintendo Wii cable.
summary: I didn't even get to have a second with this cable- No Signal

reviewText: It didn't even work the first week. I tried calling their customer service, and they knew nothing about the Madden deal. They did absolutely NOTHING to resolve the issue. I just tried it for week two and it started working. However, they don't show any local games. So they claim you can "Watch any game" , but you actually can't. This is a total scam. I will be asking for a refund and reporting them to the Better Business Bureau.
summary: Directv LIES about their product! DO NOT BUY THIS!

reviewText: The entire game is cut scenes and tutorials that you can't speed up or skip. There's no gameplay. I've been playing Mario games since the original arcade Donkey Kong, and this is by far the worst gaming experience of any Mario game I've ever played.
summary: Skip this one because you can't skip the endless tutorials

reviewText:
This game, and Mario Party 9 & 10 are terrible excuses for a Mario Party game.

I rented this title, and I'm really glad I did. It's nothing like Mario Party used to be when Hudson Soft was developing the games.

I hope and pray MP11 will return to its roots, but it seems like the best games will remain in history.

Don't buy this if you're expecting a true Mario Party game.
summary: Terrible. Don't buy if you're a fan of the previous Mario Party

reviewText: The creator of this game has a history of creating a game, giving it updates for a while, and then letting the game go. This happens to be one of them now. It has been almost a year since this game has been updated and the amount of people playing this game is getting smaller and smaller. I would suggest avoiding this game, just because the developer does not seem to care.

It looks like a fun game.  Unfortunately, you have to download a third party program, "Steam", to run it, and after you do, it still won't run. Several other users have encountered the same problem.  Don't waste your money. Hopefully, I can get mine back.

I love the Defense Grid game, I had it on a CD.  I was excited about more levels and was anxious to play.  The game is great, Steam is terrible.  It was difficult to sign up for Steam (the on-line game provider, you have to do this).  It does not work well and is not user friendly.  After a week I could no longer get the game to load.  Steam's help is non-existent.  I have been waiting 4 days for a response.  Great game, lousy game provider.

I purchased this because I really liked the older versions of CIVILIZATION.  This was horrible.  It did not load as expected.  Locked up my computer when I tried to play it.  It was a waste of $5.  Given that $5 isn't much.  But, if you're looking and can't afford the loss, keep on going.  This is a dead-end.

I was not able to get the game to work. I used this code on Steam and it accepted it but when I downloaded the game it would not even open. I am very angry and will never buy a game code again. I wish I could get my money back.
summary: DO NOT BUY THIS CODE IT WILL NOT LET YOU PLAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText:
How is the PS3 version of this game getting 5 stars? The performance is still terrible. Absolutely dreadful. Bethesda should be ashamed that they left this game in its current state. The game itself (on other platforms) is fantastic. Incredibly immersive game with great content.

I bought this mainly for the trophies, but the framerate is so bad that I just can't handle it anymore. Freezing everywhere. And the performance gets worse the deeper you get into the game. Shame on you Bethesda.
summary: How is this getting 5 stars from reviewers of the PS3 version?

reviewText: I purchased this mouse and enjoyed it for a while. After about a year, I now have problems where, during gaming, the mouse appears to 'lag' for half a second, then it comes back in. Sometimes it even 'dies' for several seconds and then I hear the Windows sound as it comes back to life, as if the software were crashing. Logitech will not fix it. I am dissatisfied with this mouse and warn others that it isn't great for gaming.
summary: I purchased this mouse and enjoyed it for a while

reviewText: I bought this mouse on March of 2014. I did not open the box and use the mouse until March of 2015. I plug the mouse into the USB port, window 7 detects it and automatically download the driver and install it. So far so good. After the mouse is working, I started to use it, only to find that both left and right button of the mouse have the same function of right clicking! Tried it on a different computer, same thing!
summary: Brand new mouse just installed and already it is not working correctly.

reviewText:
Having heard nothing but good things about the quality of Logitech's equipment, I decided to upgrade from an old Razer mouse to this one.

Things went sour almost as soon as I starting using this mouse.  Within 10 minutes the laser stopped working.  I would expect much better quality control.  I've returned the mouse to Amazon for a refund and decided to purchase from another manufacturer.

The left click button was defective and I'm in the process of returning it for a refund. I found out plenty of other people who bought this mouse also had the same problem. I will not purchase this brand again.

For whatever reason, the charger I bought did not work with my New Nintendo 3DS XL. It just wouldn't charge. I was worried that it was a problem with my 3DS itself, but I bought a new charger from Best Buy (for basically the same price as this listing) and it worked just fine. Maybe I received a dud--the unit certainly looked to be authentic. I purchased my charger from Worldwide Sales. I've shipped my defective unit back to the seller, so I hope I can get a refund.

I bought this game and it won't even install. It gets stuck on 57% and stays there for hours. Even after that, it still won't install. I've tried everything. Does anyone else have this problem? If so, can you help me out?

This game is boring. I watched the trailers and it looked like it might actually be, but it's not. If you want to watch the guy you play die many deaths then this game is for you. If you want an actual horror game that scares you, don't even bother.
summary: This game is boring. I watched the trailers and it looked like ...

reviewText: I love the COD games but this one simply sucks. The graphics are horrible, it is practically impossible to determine what is going on. I am sure next November I will buy the next one but not until it is released and see what the reviews have to say.

Don't know if this is a good game or not. My 8 year old son wanted this game for Christmas last year. He has hardly played it since he's got it.  I don't know if it's to hard for him or if he just doesn't like the game but for me it was a waste of money.
summary: Don't know if this is a good game or not

reviewText: Worst game ever, your basically just going into the dungeon and collecting coins that you can't even use. There is no cool story or anything. The only thing I like is you can play as other characters but other than that it's a waste of time.

In concept, Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon is great - it's a hack and slash gauntlet clone using the Adventure Time characters for variety and humor. In execution, it's awful. The hit detection is poor, the characters feel same-ish, the levels are boring and repetitive, the action is slow, and the game is for the most part humorless. It is hard to think of any way this game could have been made worse.

this game would have gotten a 4 star rating IF IT HAD MULTIPLAYER ON THE 3DS! i do not understand why a game BASED ON MULTIPLAYER is not offered on the 3ds platform. the game is awesome i won't lie, but the fact that there is no such thing as multiplayer on the 3ds platform at all while the other platforms do in fact have multiplayer is a real shame. what was way forward thinking!?

This is STUPID!!! If you are looking for a hard drive to play original Xbox games on the 360, DO NOT BUY!!! You need an official Xbox 360 hard drive, which this looks like it is, but trust me, IT ISN'T!!!

Based on the reviews, I purchased the hard drive to download some games. First game I bought, GTA: San Andreas, doesn't play. I keep getting an error message telling me to reload and try again. It doesn't do what I purchased the product for, download and play games. The console does see the HDD. I'm guessing because this is an aftermarket product, it is not completely compatible.
summary: Does not work with downloaded games.

reviewText: Got a red light and an error message when I turned it on so I went to the help page at Xbox.com and it told me to unplug everything and remove the hard drive, so I did and now it works fine so when I tried to put the hard drive back in it kept bringing up an error message which means the hard drive went bad, so it only lasted me 4 months and it wasn't even close to being full so this shouldn't have happened.

Do not waste your money! Bought this for my son and it stopped working after 1 month! Very disappointed because I have never had a problem with buying on Amazon until now. I buy a lot of products from Amazon but after this purchase I will have to think twice about purchasing from them. I guess you get what you pay for.

It wasn't even 320 gigs, it was 270. If I buy a 320 gig hard drive, I sure as hell want it to be what it claims to be. Don't buy this product. Don't spend more on something you aren't really getting, and for that matter buy official brand hard drives. Forget this seller, or other amazon sellers; because at the end of the day. You want a product that meets your expectations. Anything less just isn't worth your time, and neither is this horrible, rip off hard drive.

At first I thought it was amazing, but after 8 days or so it deleted everything on the hard drive. Ever since that happened it doesn't work anymore. I can't even reformat the hard drive anymore, it's practically useless now. Don't waste time and money on this, it's not worth it.

DO NOT BUY! I bought this as a gift for my brother, and it worked great for about a year and a half. But a couple weeks ago, the hard drive completely crashed! It's completely useless now and won't run any games!
summary: and it worked great for about a year and a half

reviewText: DON'T BUY THIS!! I bought this hard drive on Jan. 29 2014. Today is Sept. 28 2014. The hard drive failed on me. I turned on my Xbox and it asks me to either create a new profile or download a profile. I thought it was weird but downloaded my profile anyway. Then when I go to play a game, it says unformatted hard drive. That means that I lost all my game saves and everything I downloaded. At least I can redownload everything but my game saves are gone forever.
summary: DON'T BUY THIS!! I bought this hard drive ...

reviewText: I plugged it in to my xbox, and the xbox recognized it. I started to transfer data, and the hard drive failed while transferring data.  I tried to recover the small amount it did take, and it would not transfer it back to my original storage device. I lost a lot of game progress because of this.

The Xbox literally ruined this game for me. The TV turned itself on, and I heard voices coming from it. Obviously somebody hacked my Xbox One and was watching me. Scary. I took the XBox One P.O.S. back to the store and bought a Wii U. I'm totally satisfied now. Thank you Nintendo, sorry I didn't buy one in the first place.

This game looks amazing, but it lacks creativity. The game is pretty boring and has a very mediocre story line. The gameplay is also very repetitive. The only thing that amazed me was the visuals. I was very pumped for this game back at E3, and I probably should have read the reviews that said the game wasn't that great, it only looked good.

The Xbox literally ruined this game for me. The TV turned itself on, and I heard voices coming from it. Obviously somebody hacked my Xbox One and was watching me. Scary. I took the XBox One P.O.S. back to the store and bought a Wii U. I'm totally satisfied now. Thank you Nintendo, sorry I didn't buy one in the first place.

Rome 2 was a major disappointment for me. It crashes constantly. They just released a huge patch that was supposed to fix a lot of the issues, but it's crashing even more for me now. The gameplay is pretty lackluster, battles are boring. Hopefully they fix this mess and make it worthwhile, but I would highly suggest to anyone reading this that you wait and don't pay $60 for it or you will be as disappointed as I am.

I bought this on amazon for the family and it wasn't working right it was flashing but it wouldn't turn on right . So i return it and bought a new one and this time the screen was frozen. I try turning it off then on again and it wouldn't work. So now i am going to return it and maybe buy a playstation for the family.

After a very tedious setup I was immediately impressed with the Xbox One...until I tried to play a game.

The disc wouldn't go into the console all the way and was accompanied by loud sounds that resembled a garbage disposal.

After a few minutes of Googling I found out I am one of many, many customers who received a unit with a non-working disc drive.

I'll be happy to amend this review if I receive a working replacement in a timely manner from Microsoft.

I tried to install this game on 4 different computers to no avail. I even tried to install the directX 9 driver and it still wouldn't load. Such a disappointment for the amount of money I paid. IGT was no help whatsoever. Save your money and don't buy this game. It might be a nice game to play, if in fact it would load up. Seems to be full of kinks. I would give this 0 stars if I could.

Don't bother buying this version. It's so old that Encore won't support it, and it won't run properly -- at least not on my Windows 7 computer, although it's supposed to run under Windows 7. The Encore Hoyle Bridge is a good program, but this version doesn't work.
summary: The Encore Hoyle Bridge is a good program, but this version doesn't work

reviewText: I thought I had purchased this game from amazon a couple of months ago. Turns out I was wrong. I had to go through steam and it took a full day to download the game. Now I discovered the game is gone, it has been removed from my computer without  my permission, and if I want it back it will take a full day to reload. Cannot get any response from steam support or from amazon, so far.

Its a tightly sequenced to do list.  If you were familiar at all with the original Wolfenstein being able to roam around searching, finding, killing, this isn't it.  You have to do this first, there's nowhere else for you to go, nothing else you can do.  Then you have to do this, nowhere else you can go, nothing else you can do ...

I think they call this the storyline.  If you wanted a world to wander in, you won't find it here.
summary: This isn't a game, its a to do list

reviewText:
The game crashes constantly.

I have not been able to get two minutes into the game without it crashing.  Every time the first task is completed, a new screen pops up and then I'm directed to hit E to continue.  I have to repeat the task and the game crashes again.

I'm looking for fixes.

Dear Amazon,
These headphones worked great up until the end of August, and then slowly stopped working. At first the sound quality was getting worse, and now they have stopped working all together. They have barely been used since August, and now I find that they cannot be used at all. I realize the return window has passed, but would like to request an exception to your policy. I would like to return these for a full refund. Thank you.

This headset sucked. I had trouble getting it to work with my computer from the very beginning.  The software you're required to download in order to use it is clunky, outdated, and malfunctions frequently.  I couldn't get it to work properly with my computer.  The USB dongle malfunctioned constantly and made it impossible to use this headset with my computer.  I would not recommend this product to anyone.

I don't know where I went wrong, but the application to get the device up and running kept closing the moment it opened. I attempted to contact the makers, and they responded a few times asking for screenshots of the issue, but quickly stopped replying to me. It's been several months now since the purchase, and I still have yet to get the device to work. I wouldn't recommend it since it seems very finicky and you get no customer support when it doesn't work. Waste of my hard earned money.

I bought this two days ago and haven't been able to even play it. I downloaded the game like I was told in the step by step and now every time I go to play it nothing works. I even had my father who is a computer person look into it and still no luck. I am super frustrated with this and wish I just bought the game and waited for it to be delivered. I would advise anyone to do the same.
summary: I downloaded the game like I was told in the step by step and ...

reviewText: I followed every step, downloaded origin, and put in the codes where prompted. However every time I try to open the game itself, I get an "unknown error occurred" message and I'm completely unable to even open the game. I'm totally bummed. I'd love a refund but I'm not sure how to go about that. I wish I read the reviews before throwing my money away.
summary: I'd love a refund but I'm not sure how to go ...

reviewText: I thought I might as well buy it because the price is really low now, but it did NOT work for me. I downloaded it and entered the codes without a problem, but the game will not open. I thought they would have fixed all the issues by now, but I guess not. Maybe it has something to do with the new OS X Yosemite.

I downloaded the Sims 3 a while back. I also downloaded origin. It never worked in the first place, so I waited a while and figured I would try again. I was told to "Redeem Product Code". So I did that, and was told once again that the code had already been used. If I could give this zero stars, I would. Nobody out there should waste their money on this. If you want the Sims, just order it through the mail and use the disk to download.

This game took me almost two hours to download. After that, when I was finally able to play, it was short lived. The game froze three times in the first hour. I had to restart my computer, which was super hot. I have a few months old macbook pro. I had to delete it after a few hours.

Well obviously, if you've read other reviews, then you know that Origin sucks.  I wouldn't waste your money downloading this.  Mine worked the first two days and then it didn't, no matter what I did.  Then, a month later, I tried again and it worked for a day.  After that, it stopped working.

I feel cheated.  As far as I know, there's nothing I can do about it.  DON"T DOWNLOAD.  Spend a tad extra and buy the disk.

I've bought about 3 other expansion packs for Sims off Amazon before and they have all worked wonderfully except for this one. I've spent the last hour or so trying to download it and still haven't been able to get it. Also, the instructions are confusing. Definitely a waste of my time and money.

I got this for my nephew and though he is excited to play it, it took almost an hour for it to install and that's after the file had downloaded.  The games is extremely tedious to play on a Mac.  It is my understanding that it is using a wrapper to play on a Mac.  If I had known how much of a pain this was going to be, I would never have purchased it.
summary: Takes forever to install and plays very slow

reviewText: It won't let me play the game. I bought the download code so that I wouldn't have to wait for the disk, and after downloading a TON of stuff, when I try to play it, it keeps asking me to insert the game disk.

There is no way to play this game as it is impossible to download.  I was expecting this to be simple, not impossible.  I am a physicist, so even if it were merely difficult to download, I would have been able to do it.

I was soooo frustrated with the download version.  After 4 hours of trying to download, I gave up.  I followed the steps to the T and still nothing happened.  What a complete waste of time and energy.  I ended up getting a refund and buying the actual game.  Hopefully it will work.  Again, please take my advice and DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!
summary: DO NOT BUY THE DOWNLOAD VERSION

reviewText: DO NOT BUY.  If you are reading this after March 2016, this game is practically unplayable.  There are gigs worth of downloads you have to install and if you do not do them in the correct manner you will corrupt the game.  As of writing this there is no fix.  I spent 5 hours "installing" the game and never played it.  Apparently there are ways to get this to work, but you have to have 12+ hours to devote to just installing it.  This is unacceptable as a retail product.

Not only does it take at least 8 to 10 hours for all the downloading, it also takes an additional 4 to 6 hours for all the updates, AND it also fails to install them properly. Not only am I having this problem, others are having it as well. I deleted it from my PS3, and will NOT be playing this game, nor will I ever be playing another PDI game again. I have gran turismo for the psp, and that's a way better version than this one. I guess I wasted 15 dollars.
summary: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY

reviewText: Did not like this game.  Too many updates.  Never had a chance to play.  Wasted 3 days waiting for it to update/upgrade.  When it finally did come up it was so difficult to figure out I just traded it.

I bought this because: Sim City!

I should have paid attention to the reviews. The DRM meant that if their servers were having trouble, I could not play my game, and since EA apparently way underestimated the number of servers they would need, I could not even play my game once it arrived at my home. Servers were always down or full, so I could not play the game for which I paid all that money.

I will NEVER buy another EA game. EVER.
summary: I so regret buying this game

reviewText: EA is horrible and they ruined another game.  I bought this on pre order and couldn't play it for a couple of days.  When I finally did, the maps were small and I had problems playing with my friend.  The game is so horrible I haven't even played it in 5 months even though I bought it.  Not worth my time.

If I could rate this game lower I would.

I was really excited to get this game and I preordered it due to all the hype.

I'm sorry I bought it. EA should be ashamed of this game. It bogs down and is buggy. I constantly get an error saying the game is unstable and it crashes, losing all of my progress.

In short, don't buy it.

I have never been more disappointed by a video game before. I'm not writing this review on day one while I'm angry about not being able to log in, I waited it out, I waited for version 2.0 despite preordering this game and being unable to play it at all for the first few days.
This game isn't worth playing, even if they fixed all of the well known issues they'd need to make the maps about 5 times larger before I'd even bother trying again.

The game is fun, I really enjoyed it, but it is like eating a really good steak, or rather just a good steak, but having it covered in cheap stale steak sauce.

If you don't have internet all or nearly all the time you will be unable to play the game, and for no reason other than the irrational fear of piracy. It also seems to slow everything down every time you have to wait for data to transfer. Nothing about your game is stored locally. All of your saves are stored on EA's file servers.

Here are two quotes from EA President Frank Gibeau: "SimCity started out and felt like an MMO more than anything else and it plays like an MMO." And "I'm disappointed that we didn't do a better job communicating that upfront."

As none of the previous games in the series was, or aspired to be a MMO, I feel like I've been misled.

Bottom line: If you want to play SimCity on your own this game is not for you.

The title says it all. This game is not up-to-par with any previous SimCity game, other than Simcity Social. If you want to play Simcity Social, you can play for free on Facebook, and the servers for that are actually up.
summary: Shouldn't be called SimCity, shouldn't be $60.

reviewText: This is a single player game that's currently gimped due to the multiplayer infrastructure. But it's also a multiplayer game... that has none of the social features you would expect from an MMO game. Hopefully they can learn from their mistakes, but I doubt it.

This game had/has so much promise, but in nearly every way, it is more of a beta release than a fully developed game.  After putting up with the server issues the first week, it's clear the simulation of city activity doesn't work.  In theory, Maxis can fix those issues, but it's not nearly there yet.  It's hard to imagine why this game was released in its current state.

I regret buying this game...I spent $60 on it and I am so disappointed. I have not bought a game in over a year and I was excited to try this. I could not even play for the first week that I got it because it kept saying to server was down. I did not know when I bought it that I had to be on the internet to play it- I would have NEVER bought it. $60 down the drain!!!

Not sure why the developers found it necessary to keep the always-online DRM in this product, as they were warned well in advance of the product's release that many gamers would sit this one out because of it.  Lo and behold, the DRM doesn't work.  The idea that you have to be online in order to play a single player game by yourself is absolutely ludicrous.

I've owned this game for five days, and thus far, I have only been able to play the tutorial once and create three cities.  The game didn't save any of my cities, and the next time I tried to play, it made me play the whole tutorial again.  THEN I selected a server, which said was available, but wouldn't allow me to create or join any regions.  It kept telling me to go to the main menu and try again. I'll wait a few more days and see if the issues are fixed, but this is seriously ridiculous!

I'm a long-time fan of the Sim games, and was looking forward to introducing Sim City 5 to my kids. No more. I want to play it offline if I want to, as I travel a lot, and that's when I usually have the time to do it. Sorry, EA; the game looks great, but you've really dropped the ball on this one.

I also have to say my experience with this game has been entirely negative. The problem is not that there are not enough servers, it's that there is no reason for a single player game to require servers at all. You cannot save your games on your own computer. If they put out a new version and close this down, all of your games will be gone. I will continue to rate this at 1 star until they come out with an update to no longer require play on EA's servers. Shame on EA for this crappy game.
summary: Tell me when it no longer requires servers.

reviewText: This game has a lot of potential, but so far I haven't been able to play.  You are required to be connected to the internet to play this game.  So far the EA servers have been down or spotty since I got the game.  I really hate having to be connected to play. I understand about the multiplayer, but I don't play multiplayer games, especially with a game like Simcity.  I want to like this game, but so far it hasn't giving me a chance to.
summary: May rate higher if I could ever get it to work

reviewText: You must be online to play this game. That means if your internet is down, away from your home (without a solid internet connection), or at some point when EA decides to stop supporting the game servers you won't be able to play anymore.  This is a serious concern for a $60 game.  I was quite excited for this but after reading more than a few terrible reviews, my $60 is better spent elsewhere.

I don't know if this qualifies as a product review because I am having no success in connecting to the server. I've been trying for about an hour but it didn't let me in once. I haven't played the game but I give 1/5 rating because they are not letting me play the game I purchased for 60 dollars. I hate it. I wish I could return it.

However, 9 out of 10 times that I try to play it, some server is offline preventing you from playing it.  Unfortunately, 3 days after launch, the game is still largely unplayable, and the situation doesn't seem to be getting any better.
summary: The game is fun when you're lucky enough to actually play it

reviewText:
This always on DRM is ridiculous. Being forced to have an always on connection to play what is essentially a single player game is ridiculous. EA is ridiculous.

I've had this game for a couple of days now and I've yet to play it. Server are always down. When I do connect, I'm disconnected even before a game can start.

EA needs to patch this game so you can play it without an internet connection. What a bunch of BS.
summary: DRM so effective that I nor anyone else can play it

reviewText: I can't play this game.  I would love to!  It just won't let me!  WTF have you done to this game EA/Marxis?  This is pathetic.  This game should be offline and single player.  What if I don't have internet access and I want to play this game?  I am requesting a refund.  Will never buy an always online game ever again.

Being an "older gamer" I have seen a lot of bad product launches since the mid-80's.  This is by far the worst.  If there was ANY way to get a refund I would and I will NEVER buy another EA game.  SimCity is not an MMO and even if it was, EA has proved they have no concept how to design and build the infrastructure to support one.  If you haven't yet purchased, save yourself hours of frustration and go elsewhere.

Always online DRM is a terrible idea.  I have had the game since it released, and I have been able to play it twice.  If the servers can't handle being online at all times, then there should be an offline option for those of us who don't care about playing with other people.

I didn't buy this game because all of the reviews for it are so horrible. I LOVE SimCity. Can't tell you how many times I've played it. This game, however, with the always on DRM, will NEVER be purchased by me. Sorry, EA. You failed big time here.

I bought the prerelease and I'm sorry I spent the money. I held off writing a review until EA had a chance to fix their growing pains. Unfortunately, EA has attempted to fix their growing pains, and the game still doesn't work. The tutorial starts, nothing is displayed, and it sucks. I'd give it zero stars if I could. I petitioned EA for a refund and they refuse to honor it.
summary: It's about as fun as you can have not playing something

reviewText: There's a lot I could say about this game, but I'd be wasting my time. DO NOT BUY. The other reviews are spot on, horrific game, horrific execution, there's literally not a single positive thing I can say about it even if I struggled.

This is what the world of gaming looks like when Electronic Arts gets their hands on a great franchise.

E.A. destroyed Command & Conquer, the greatest RTS series of all time. They ruined Ultima Online, once the leading MMORPG. Now they've made a laughing stock of SimCity, the best city building series every developed.

Do not reward these people with your money.

I did.

And now I'm stuck waiting in an online queue to play a single player game.

Yeah.

EA has completely lost touch with it's fan base. In an attempt to stop people from pirating their (wildly successful) franchise, they are taking out their frustration on all of us. EA has become one of the worst video game producers of late, they are slowly poisoning each and every franchise they own. I will never buy from them again they just want more money in their wallets and don't care about the end user or the long term viability of their company or products. They don't listen, they don't learn.

I've had the game since launch and haven't been able to play more than a couple minutes of it. I can't even comment on the other issues I've heard about such as land plot size and game play quirks because I just haven't been able to start up and continuously play a proper game.
summary: When do I get to play?

reviewText:
This game comes with an "Always Online" policy to enforce DRM.

Unfortunately, EA controls the servers the game requires us to connect to and they have proven, in the most amateurish way possible, that they are not able to support a game like this. As a result, despite trying, I have yet to play this game.

I am constantly told to check back again.

As others have pointed out already - I have paid $60 for a game that cannot even be launched.

Look at your plant. Now back at your SimCity. Now back at your plant. Now back at your SimCity. Sadly, your SimCity doesn't move as fast as your plant. That could be solved if you play an earlier version of the game and let EA rot with their servers. I'm on a horse now.
summary: As fun as watching my plants grow

reviewText: I'm not into playing these types of games with people, I'd rather play alone.  If I play alone, I still have to have a constant internet connection in order for the game to be playable, period.  You have zero choice.  There are so many things wrong with this game, I don't have time to lay them out.  I would not recommend this game to anybody.  EA does not care about the gamer at all.

I was going to get this game until I found out you need to always be connected to the Internet. I don't have Internet at my house, I just use my phone. So I guess I'm not getting this one.
Also, I wouldn't support another one of these always online games anyways. If they want my money, don't make it harder for me because you don't want to lose alittle money from pirates.
You have enough money ea, stop being greedy...

This game requires a persistent Internet connection even if you want to play it single player, by yourself, with no interaction with other players at all.

Additionally, that's a best-case scenario. If the servers go down or are otherwise unreachable, which is completely out of your control, you are unable to play the game at all.

Since I ordered a new game, I expected it to come in good condition and inside of a case, or at least a sturdy package to keep the disc from being damaged. Instead, I received a scratched disc in a paper envelope that was falling apart and secured with a rubber band. I tried to download the game twice and it will not work. The product description stated "brand new" and "factory sealed." I am extremely disappointed.
summary: Game does not work and arrived in terrible condition

reviewText:
Bought this game because I've had SimCity 2000, 3000, 3000 Unlimited and 4.

I had high hopes but as of yet I've been only able to do the following:

1) Install the game
2) Play the tutorial

That's it. Then I was told the server was busy. Then I was put in a queue for 45 minutes.

Then I tried another server and it tried to make me go through the tutorial again. Then the game sat at loading the tutorial for 30 minutes.

Very disappointed and wish I could return it.

This was just a letdown. I can't believe money was spent on this. It's just bad. The developers do such a great job, it's a shame they're forced to implement backward-ass DRM. It would be a decent game if it weren't for EA's nazi requirements to play the game, so I won't be playing this game ever, and I will never support EA ever again.

Yeah, I bought it. Yeah, I attempted to play it. Yeah, I was excited to revisit the classic days of SC3k and SC4. Yeah, I had to attempt several times to force my way through. Yeah, once I got in it was a little buggy. Yeah, the fun factor wasn't completely there.

The end.
summary: Throwing my hat in the ring

reviewText: I have to say that the game was enjoyable and deep in it's AI as well as the visual aspects of it, it was very fun during my beta testing.  However, I will not be buying the game because of the DRM system.  Not only will I not buy a game that requires me to be online all the time (unless it's a MMO) but I won't be buying a game that in 10 years time I can't get nostalgic and begin to play again because EA has decided they no longer want to support the game.  Nope, not getting any of my money here.
summary: Won't be buying it, although beta tested it

reviewText: Unfortunately, by limited they mean limited use.  As in, they only allow a limited number of players a limited view of the game for a limited time.  They could shut down the servers at any time and no one would be able to play at all.  There is no good reason to do this for a single player game.
summary: They weren't kidding when they said Limited Edition!

reviewText:
Tons of people have summed up my problems with this game. I'm a longtime fan of the series, been playing it for years and loving it. EA'S DRM has RUINED one of my all-time favorite series. DO NOT buy this game. There are tons of similar games you get get that aren't from EA.

In fact, if this is what EA thinks a business model should look like, I'm going to avoid buying any games from EA from now on. They've lost a long-time fan.

I bought the game yesterday and after a few hours of trying to log in to the servers I eventually just gave up. It is really frusturating to think I spent 60 dollars on a game I can't even play because the makers weren't willing to fork over some extra money for servers. As for the game play itself I wouldnt know because I have never accessed it.

Enjoy.
summary: Bought the game but I still haven't been able to play it

reviewText: Well I would love to say that this is the greatest game that I have ever played but I wouldn't know yet. For the past three days after hours of trying I feel like I should just give up. I have yet to connect to a server and the game has been totally unplayable. I would recommend not buying this game and EA should be issuing refunds as we speak.

I REALLY wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing this through Amazon.  My dealings with Amazon have always been great but this setup is ridiculous.  I can't even cancel the order and I'm certainly not going to download any more programs to play a game.  If I could give this a minus 5 stars, I would.

Shame on you, Amazon, for setting up this type of situation.

I'm glad I read other reviews first. Then I looked at the Description page. It says you have to have internet access and an Origin account. I would have wanted to play it on my phone since I don't have internet. The purchase page also reads that purchases are non-refundable. You have to read the fine print so you don't get burned.

The game will freeze consistently at various points in the level, making it difficult to progress in the game.  The graphics are less than stellar for a Wii U title.  Multiplayer leaves much to be desired in terms of game play.  I'm a fan of the classic Pac-Man arcade game, but I regret purchasing this title.
summary: The game will freeze consistently at various points in the ...

reviewText: Just got this game for Christmas.  First of all, the graphics are very poor, everything looks kind of hazy.  The maps are very confusing to follow.  I still can't figure out how to even exit the game without logging out.  Definitely a waste of money, I'm trading it in for something else.
summary: confusing, a real downgrade from Need for Speed Hot Pursuit

reviewText:
I'm not an xbox super geek. I bought this game and it didn't work because I don't have an external hard drive. That is so stupid. I guess you can't just buy a game and expect it to work.

VERIFY YOUR SYSTEM BEFORE BUYING!

Unless you have a MS Xbox 360 controller, DO NOT PURCHASE this game.  According to EA, the only controller the game is written for is the Xbox 360 controller.  Otherwise you have to use your keyboard.  Truly not worth it.  If you are interested in this game, go to the EA/Origin forums and check to see if they ever receive a patch.

Something is wrong with this device.  I did not get to use this right away, as it is not the primary controller. It does not allow me to control the games. It does nothing that I attempt. I know that this unit is used, but it should not have been sold to anyone.

I bought this for my son last Christmas and less than 6 months later it no longer works. I still have the original controllers for our PS3 console, which is more than 4 years old now, and they still work great. This one was a waste of money; I should have purchased a brand new one instead.

I was so excited for a deadpool game.  I finally got time to download and install the game and it doesn't work.  Well, it works, but the graphics layers are not coming up correctly.  I haven't had this problem with any other game I have played.  I have missing walls, invisible obstacles and the game is pretty much unplayable.  I tried to go to activision support, but support isn't even available for the game.  I have never been this upset by a video game purchase.

The game is Good but the best part of previous versions is the multi-player capabilities. In this version, you are only allowed to have two players on the same screen instead of the usual four. This really limits having friends over to play together in the same room. I wish I had known that before I bought the game, I would have bought something else.
summary: Only allows 2 player split screen instead of 4.

reviewText: The single player campaign is pretty fun, but it doesn't last long for game play. The multiplayer, on the other hand, is quite broken. The list of problems with it is just too numerous to list here. No question the worst on line game play I have ever experienced.

The Xbox literally ruined this game for me. The TV turned itself on, and I heard voices coming from it. Obviously somebody hacked my Xbox One and was watching me. Scary. I took the XBox One P.O.S. back to the store and bought a Wii U. I'm totally satisfied now. Thank you Nintendo, sorry I didn't buy one in the first place.

This is by far the worst COD multiplayer experience to date.  The campaign is okay, at best.  However, most people buy COD for the multiplayer and this version fails to deliver in a big way.  In fact, it feels like things went backwards.  The biggest issue by far are the maps.  They are way too big and complicated.  This results in nothing but a camp-fest.  It looks like the future of this franchise rests solely in Treyarch's hands.  For the time being, I'll be sticking with Black Ops 2 on the 360.

The performance of this game is just awful, nowhere near as good at the PS4. No joke, this game looks so awful on the Xbone that I thought it was a PS2 game, while the PS4 version looks so good that it almost looks like real life.

Great game, but the Xbone version is just a joke, as with everything xbone. Do yourself a favor and purchase the PS4 version, which is and incredibly better version of this game.
summary: Pathetic attempt at call of duty, full of DRM and microtransactions

reviewText: They game is just like GTA, just with a different story. The only fun thing to do is running around the city. But you can only do that for so long. But the graphics looks way better on the PS4. So if you are going to buy this game its obvious on what console you are going to buy it for

If you're reading reviews about this game and just happen to stumble across this one, please savor these words:

If you buy this game you will never be the same. Something in your soul will snap, and you live out the rest of your days in a haunted daze wondering why you never listened to this review. Run as far away from your computer as you can. There is still time.

You've been warned.

I got it for xbox one on release day, and had less issues with it on day one then I do today. Customer service is useless, and their patches seem to do more harm than good. I want to love this game, I really do, but they make it so hard to do. I'll change my rating if/when they fix it.

If I could give this game 0 stars, I'd do it in a heartbeat. I have nothing to say other than this is the most broken, unplayable, PoS game I have ever played in my entire life and I have played A LOT of games. Ive been with the original Xbox and have always loved almost every gaming experience I have had. Im seriously at a loss for words for how bad this game is. I would gladly accept a full refund for both premium and the disc and never play it again.
summary: Please take my word for it, save your money. Dont buy this broken and unfinished game...

reviewText: Game doesn't work. Period. This game was rushed out and clearly was not ready to be released. Huge disappointment as you can't play multiplayer without the game crashing, and you can't play single player because your progress keeps getting reset/erased. If they fix the game it will be a great experience, but I would not waste your money at this time.
summary: Save your money, wait for them to fix this buggy game.

reviewText:
Don't do it, really, don't buy this unless you want to be VERY frustrated.

If you buying it for your kids, don't, you'll never hear the end of it!

Bugs galore and I can usually live with my fair share of them.
summary: You or your kids will be nothing but frustrated by the bugs...

reviewText: This game keeps on crashing and we have not been able to use it. It has been very frustrating and we don't seem to find the reason why it crashes on Windows. We get a message that windows will let us know when it figures out how to resolve this issue. It has been 3 days and this issue is not resolved. We would like to get our money back.
summary: The game crashes and will not start

reviewText: I was about 60% through the game when it decided to delete my save files. This is in addition to times when it would freeze, or my character would get stuck, and various other bugs. There was also a time where I couldn't left click at all in the game, but I managed to figure that out from searching online.

If you are buying the "PC" game then buyer beware!!! This game has A LOT of bugs that Warner Bros. has yet to fix. I currently can't even get the game to make it to the startup screen and there are a large number of people having issues on other gaming platforms also such as PS3 and XBOX. I'm no beginner when it comes to troubleshooting hardware / software glitches, bugs, etc. I'm glad I only paid $20 for this crap when it was on sale on Amazon and not $50. You've been warned.
summary: LOTS OF BUGS IN THE GAME THAT PREVENTS YOU FROM PLAYING / STARTING IT.
